  5. I have been using Braun epilators for years to remove facial hair, primarily over my lip. My last epilator was more than 10 years old and the motor was beginning to sound strained. Also I wanted one that could be cordless for traveling internationally, so I bought this new one.<br /><br />It is sensational. I have to admit that I use it not as advised. None of the attachments work for me on my face so I just take the whole attachment part off and use it without one. I'm sure Braun would be horrified but I used my old one this way too and it works fine. This new epilator is fast, much less painful, and somehow is getting the hair out deeper from the root because it is growing back slower. I am really happy with it. I can't speak to its use on other body parts but would assume it would work good there too. Certainly it was worth the money for me.

  11. This gadget is AMAZING! I purchased an &#34;Epilady&#34; eight years ago and have used it ever since, tolerating a high level of pain for the end results. Little did i know how far technology has progressed in the epilator world since then. After so much use, it recently broke down, propelling me to do research for a new one. I found this one by BRAUN and after using it for the first time i feel like i traded in my Honda for a Bentley! I epilated my entire body in under an hour!! And on a scale from 1-10, discomfort was a 1 on non-sentitive areas and a 5 on very sensitive areas. I noticed the blades on this device are very thin and do not pinch the skin, like my previous one. And yes, it does pull from the root and did not seem to break the hairs at all. The process is a piece of cake and the device is super easy to clean!! I'm glad i spent the extra money. Btw, i have not tried it wet yet since my hairs are easier to see when dry. Doubt i'll be using it in the shower, unless i'm in a rush one day!
  12. I love this epilator. I have been using my old epilator for about 20 years. I bought another brand and liked it, but it only alsted about 6 months before it quit. This one gets the hairs out of my leg quickly and the light is in a position and bright enough to actually make a difference. I also love being using the trimmer in the shower. I think it said not to use the trimmer or shaver in the shower, but I am ignoring that and use it in there anyway.
  13. I had never even heard of an epilator before I bought this 4 days ago but I must say it really does work. I went crazy and did my legs, arms, stomach, and even my armpits and they're still super smooth. I do have to warn you guys this is the most pain I have ever felt in my life. I've never been tattooed but I imagine it feels just like epilating. I bought the Braun 7681 because I was new to this and wanted to make sure it worked and it does, but you can buy a much cheaper Braun that works just the same. I would go with the Braun 7181 it doesn't include all the accessories that the 7681 has but in my opinion they're not really all that helpful and the 7181 is prettier and pink haha. Ohhhh and if you're hoping to do your bikini area with this good luck I tried but it's way too painful and I think I have a pretty good pain tolerance
  14. It could have been a great experience... Except my sister ordered Emoji epilator and I tried it. This Braun won for me because of the light and ability to switch the heads to make it work for any area of the body. Emoji is wider, so it's harder to maneuver. It also doesn't have a light feature that helps things out if you don't want to keep shifting positions while sitting in front of a lamp. Over all, if you need to epilate large and flat areas: legs, back etc. Emoji is the best thing you can find. If you are willing to suffer more pain and make epilator your go to solution to most hair removal problems - you will have to stick to Braun. It's good - it just doesn't match up in speed and painlesness to technique that Emoji implemented

  22. I use this for the chest, shoulders, back and the outlying areas of the armpits. I manscaped with a Wahl trimmer prior to first use, bringing everything down to at most 1/4&#34;. I must say, even though there is a significant fear factor and intensity not unlike pain involved, this is true of any epilator and this model is much more productive than the Emjoi I purchased and threw out last year. (That is, more good plucks and less skin ripping for the same amount of pain.) I was able to get from 1&#34; below the waistline all the way up to my neck done in one charge. The nicest thing about such a productive tweezing drum is that there were no ingrown hairs at the waistline area. I have very sensitive skin and this has always been why had so rarely shaved my chest. One week later and I touched up around the outer regions of the armpits, back, shoulders and another pass over new growth of the chest. While this worked on the peach fuzz missed by the previous use, the new growth of darker hairs was less inclined to pluck and broke off. I ended up shaving this for a better appearance, but it didn't amount to much stubble. I would recommend letting new growth grow to about 1/8&#34; before going over it again. Other than that, I can see this machine as a real way to keep a stubble-free beach body for weeks at a time! On a side note, the color of the device is a sparkly white, but not irridescent or overtly feminine. They really should market the same model in a more masculine aesthetic, though.
  23. I have used Remington before, but Braun is so much better and a lot less pain with epilation. Highly recommend it
  24. I would recommend this to ones, who have dense hair :) Ii works fine and lasts more than an hour, when its fully charged
  25. Wish I would have started epilating sooner. Besides for using one when they first came out over 20 years ago and gave up, I have not used an epilator. I was afraid it would be painful and I would have paid the $$$ for it to just sit around. But I did what they said in the reviews-- shaved first (with the direction of hair growth), exfoliated with a sugar/salt scrub and used corn starch after a hot shower and for the first week just keep doing a little at a time. Did not really hurt on my legs, and arm pits were the most sensitive. I am using it about 2 months and love it. Still a little sensitive on the underarms but not bad. I used to have to shave daily with the hair growth if I was going out in public in shorts/ skirt and my hair always grew back course black in less than a day. Now the hair is thin, I epilate about once a week because stray hairs appear but unless you really inspect the legs you don't see them. It is wonderful. I read many reviews and picked the Braun because they said it was faster than most and I figured if it was going to be painful I wanted it to be quick. Now that I have used the epilator and the hair growth is not as fast , A single full charge lasts for me that can I complete both legs, armpits, bikini area.
  26. This product is excellent.I can see it is picking very short hair too.I don't think i can stay without epillator and this one fulfill my purpose. But still its little bit stronger for lips area as it took my skin too but i didnot use its attachment . Messager really work well.Overall good product.I used more than 1 year
  27. This is my first use and purchase of an epilator, so I'm by no means an expert, but my limited experience with this device has been good. I primarily wanted to try an epilator on my underarms. I hate shaving there every couple of days during the summer and I've read that it can be bad for your body to be constantly irritated/absorbing the chemicals in deodorants. I tried the epilator first on my legs, just to see what the pain experience would be like. For me, the legs are a no-go. I only did my calves and while the pain wasn't too bad, it took a LONG time and I had a red, bumpy rash there for the rest of the night. I do have sensitive skin and my leg hair is thin and pretty light, so I just don't feel willing to commit to using this product on my legs.<br /><br />Now, for my underarms, it was a whole different story! Yes, it hurts, I'm not going to lie...but the results so awesome! I have epilated twice now, about 10 days apart. The first time was difficult, it hurt and it was hard to find the right angles and find the method that worked best for me. The second time took me only about 5 min. and, while the pain was still there, was more bearable. The results are great! My pits have never looked so smooth and razor burn free! I have not had any problems with ingrown hairs, but I have used an exfoliating scrub 2-3 times in between epilating sessions. I have also found that applying baby powder to the skin first allows for the machine to glide more smoothly over the area. I also recommend using aloe vera immediately after...it stings quite a bit, but it will prevent infection and helps keep the skin smooth.<br /><br />I didn't give this product the full 5 stars, because I think the attachments are a bit of a joke. I have been using the one specifically for underarms/bikini line and it is just a little plastic head that goes over the normal epilator head. I am afraid to use the regular one for these areas as it is much larger and might catch my skin, but only the regular head has the massager built in. The speeds, light, and charging all worked well for me.<br /><br />Overall, I would recommend this product for some uses as long as you can tolerate a little pain!
  28. The charging cable doesn't fit the device, falls out on a flat surface - you have to tape the charging cable to the device to keep it connected.<br /><br />The motor is weak, and is ineffective at pulling hair out. It misses 85% of hair per pass, but if you move it more than 5mm per second, fails to remove any hair at all. Doing 2 square inches takes roughly 5 minutes.<br /><br />Wet, dry, baby powder, epilation treatment - doesn't matter, performance is horrible. The plastic head with grooves is the fastest, but only by a slight margin.<br /><br />The trimmer head teeth are too large, and tend to cut slices out of you even if you're careful.<br /><br />I'm a big fan of Braun engineering, but this looks like it was designed by Play-Skool.
  29. I bought this epilator as my previous one died after more than 6 years. The head is very fast and the hair removal very effective.<br /><br />I think it's also more comfortable than my previous one.<br /><br />Only negative is that the head is not very wide
  30. Stupid me paid $100.00 for this and it is no better than the one i have thats like 5 years old. Being cordless and waterproof is a plus but the battery does not hold a long charge and unless your hair is somewhat long you're better off shaving with a razor!!<br />Save your money

  36. The Braun Epilator works amazingly well. Is it painful? Yes, but it becomes less and less painful with each additional use (in the same area). Make sure you read the instructions, i.e. hair is trimmed to appropriate length and be sure to pull your skin tight - it makes a big difference. And I had better results using the epilator dry versus wet. I haven't seen results that last anywhere near 4 weeks, but maybe that will happen after continued repeated use. But I'm definitely using an epilator a lot less frequently than I was using a razor.

I tried laser treatments and was so dissappointed in the result. Luckily I used a groupon but I was still out $108 dollars and I didn't even finish the treatments because I was at the point of why bother. So, I started researched other ways to remove unwanted hair and I came across this product. After reading many reviews I choose the Braun SE7681 and I love it!   41. I bit the bullet and chose the Braun Silk-Epil 7681 Wet and Dry because it's designed to be used in the bath and shower. As I love my baths, I mistakenly thought AHA! soaking in the bath will loosen up my leg hair follicles and therefore make the hair removal process tolerable. Uh, wrong unfortunately. For some reason, removing the hair on my upper lip is not a problem, and neither is removing strays from between my eyebrows. If you don't have a problem with hair removal pain then I recommend this model. It is light, charges quickly, holds a long charge, has a light, multiple heads, can be clean under running water and used wet and dry. However, if you are like me in the hair removal pain department this probably is not the best option.
  42. I have the [[ASIN:B004QI8UJK Braun SE 5280 Silk Epil 5 Epilator With Ice Glove, Pink]], and though the 7681 Wet and Dry Epilator has more stuff and is faster, I found that I much prefer the 5280. I have very fine hair on my legs, and the 7681 while it goes faster than the 5280, does not pick up the hairs on my legs near as well as the 5280. While the attachments, like for the face is a nice touch, I can go get waxed, or use an at home product like [[ASIN:B0058AGBYG Olay Smooth Finish Facial Hair Removal Duo 1 Kit]] (which I have used and liked) that actually works better than the epilator. The razor does work well on the 7681, though.<br /><br />All in all, I just don't see this as a worthy upgrade, especially for the cost.

  64. Alright, first I want to send a shoutout to my fellow PCOS sufferers - I feel your assorted pains and problems. I'm going to address all the areas I have used this on already, but the facial section is dedicated to my sisters!<br /><br />First things first - epilation is NOT painless -so pull on your big girl panties - I promise you can make it. I do have a pretty high pain threshold, so I know it hurts me less than it might others, but it really isn't horrible and it does hurt less the more you do it. Some areas hurt more than others, and the first couple of times you do it, your skin is going to look like a plucked chicken - so don't be thinking you are gonna get them legs sexy smooth and then ride out to town in your little black dress! The red bumps go away in a few hours (overnight at the longest) and then everything is back to looking good. The &#34;plucked chicken&#34; effect is lessened if you use it in the shower when your pores are more open, and you can minimize &#34;healing&#34; time by putting aloe vera gel on right afterwords.<br /><br />The wipes than came with this did nothing for me. A lot of people say they reduce the pain, I didn't think they did anything at all, so to each their own. You should definitely exfoliate your skin before you use it - it will make the hairs stand up better and make them easier to grab. Just make sure that IF you are using it dry, you get your skin dry and free of any and all lotions, oils, etc.<br /><br />Face - This is the ONLY solution I have ever found for the facial hair that comes from PCOS. I've tried having it waxed, tried waxing it myself, everything. I finally gave up and started shaving every day, my sideburns and my multiple chins ;). This is soo frustrating and can really make you feel like less of a woman when you shave more than your husband does! So, enter my search for hair removal that lasted longer than 5 hours and didn't require me to put makeup on every time I left the house. I haven't used this onmy sideburns yet, but I have used it on my chin and it is AMAZING. I have used epilators in the past, and unless you use a GOOD quality one, you wind up just having the hairs break near the root instead of actually being pulled out. This pulls the hairs cleanly, with a minimum of pain, and leaves my skin feels so smooth and soft.<br /><br />Arms - I did my arms dry, but after trying this wet, that is how I will be using it from now on! In my experience with any and all epilators, doing my arms feels like having a series of tiny needles poked in them really quickly, repeatedly. So, not the most pleasant of sensations, but it is completely tolerable and does get better each time you do it. My arms looked PERFECT after the first session - its been a week and so far so good!<br /><br />Legs - I did my legs for the first time today in the shower- between doing them wet and my arms dry, I have to say the shower makes a HUGE difference. I was in the shower about ten minutes and did all my other things before I did this, to give my pores time to really open up. Just go slow, and start with a part of your leg that is fleshier. I know we all tend to start with that strip right over the shin, but that is the most painful part - so do yourself a favor and work up to that.<br /><br />Overall, this is an AMAZING product, and I highly recommend it!!!!
  65. Extremely painful for thick hair. Not for everyone.

  76. A person needs to keep a standard weekly appointment with this thing otherwise you need to go back to using a razor and regroup again.
  77. I decided to get this epilator because I wasn't sure if I would prefer epilating wet or dry. It turns out I much prefer going dry because the process takes a long time and I don't like being in the shower for that long. It also seems more effective for me. I committed myself to using it for a full year since it takes a while to get used to, and it's been about 9 months now. So here are my main review areas so far:<br /><br />Battery life: Battery lasts long enough for me to do my full legs but not much else. Or I could do my underarms, bikini area, and upper legs. That's annoying because it seems to take about an hour to fully recharge, even if you haven't used it down to low battery. In fact, I haven't timed it but it seems to take almost as long to charge after just 5 minutes of use as it would if you had run the battery down completely. Since I use it dry, there's no reason for me to have an epilator that can't operate while plugged in.<br /><br />Effectiveness: My results varied for each part of my body. The attachments make this really good for my underarms and bikini area (and beyond, with a lot of care and topical painkiller). It works ok on the fine hair of my upper legs, but I get a horrendous amount of broken hairs and ingrowns on my lower legs. I've tried a lot of things like going slower--so it takes forever--and varying the angle, but I think that part of my body is just not well suited to epilating. I suspect that going against the hair growth (like the instructions say) contributes to the problem.<br /><br />Noise: All epilators are probably fairly loud, and this one is no exception. I've reluctantly used it in hotels and thin-walled apartments, and try to do it at times when the neighbors aren't around because I find the noise embarrassing and potentially annoying to others. One effective way to stifle the noise is to use it under water in the tub. I still got satisfactory results that way.<br /><br />Other features: This comes with a good variety of attachments. I personally don't like the one that's meant for the bikini zone because I find it too narrow, so I use the one for underarms on all my sensitive areas. I haven't tried the razor feature so I can't comment on that. I usually find the light useful, but not always necessary. I really wish there was a way to disable it to save battery life.<br /><br />Bottom line, I prefer epilating dry so my next epilator will be corded. That way I won't be limited by battery life. I will keep this one because the attachments work well on my underarms and bikini zone. It may also become handy for quick touch-ups, both dry and in the shower. I think it's a good model to start with so you can see if you prefer wet or dry epilating, and also because it has a lot of features for the price.
  78. Amazing! Functional and easy use. Enough tools to change according to the purpose we need short, very short hair.
  79. So, this is my first epilator, and after having had a suspenseful first moments, I finally put it against my skin and it actually wasn't that bad. The pain was tolerable, although I did use the pre-epilation wipes, so I dont know if that had much to do with it (I put it in the fastest mode). I started in a part of my leg that I knew wouldn't hurt (knowledge left over from previous sugar waxing adventures!) and moved on from there, though I didn't go too high up to my thigh cuz I know it's gonna hurt more. I mean, shaving with regular razors was enough to irritate my skin even with soap. Razors never really worked for me and because my skin is light you could still see the dark hair under my skin :( just terrible. Hence, the epilator. It works really well, I liked it cuz its just like using tweezers! the initial redness after epilation went away fairly quickly too. It got most or all of the hairs, so I was really pleased. Of course, if you're going to epilate, you have to exfoliate, and I'm really new to exfoliating so my skin didn't look perfect due to the fact that I didn't exfoliate at all during any of my past hair removal efforts. The result? Ingrowns :( *sigh* I'm sure they'll go away as I keep exfoliating though, I bought exfoliating gloves and also antibacterial soap so I wont get any skin infections. I have to buy some alcohol free lotion to hydrate my skin though. (the things I put myself through!) Anyways, I do love how my skin is mostly smooth! :) It's an awesome feeling; something I could barely achieve with razors, and even then, it didn't last long. Making sugar wax was just too messy (though economical), and I burned myself last time. :( I was torn between this model and the one that has the exfoliating head. I don't regret my decision but it would have been easier to do the whole exfoliating thing with that one (I would think) I haven't tried most of the extra caps, except the shaver one. The epilator is relatively easy to clean and sanitize as well. :) If you do decide to get one, Happy Epilating! You'll at least like, if not love the results. remember to exfoliate!

  96. Hello. Now usually I never comment on anything I buy. Buy this was a very big purchase for me and to be honest I was skeptical and worried I wasted 100 bucks. Well a little bit more. So hopefully someone is reading this and I hope it helps. I've done a lot of research before I purchase. And to be honest. It works. Not what I expected though. I was expecting like a new fresh shaved peg after using this. But it did not give me that. But when I check the epilator when I'm done using it I do see alot of hair... Alot. So much it's so discussing I have that much. So yes it does pull my hairs. But it does not give me a smooth sexy leg. But my hairs have grown in much thinner and lighter that even without epilating for a week you can't tell I have hairs unless you have a magnifying glass. Lol. And also, when I first used it my legs were so red and so many red bumps. But it does get better after each use. I've been using it for a month and a half. I still get a few bumps here and there. But they fade in like a hour. Also biggest thing! Exfoliating is very important when using this. I didn't exfoliat one night because of laziness and the next day I got ingrown hairs. It was horrible. But if you exfoliat before and after use you should be fine. Do not recommend putting on lotion after epilating... painful... it burns. Lol. Just wash your leg and exfoliat. If you think this is a easier way to shave and your trying to find the lazy way out think again. I'm all about lazy but this does involve work. But in time it's worth it. I only have to use the epilator like once a week. And I'm german.... so I'm a very hairy person. And this does work. Now with pain.... it does hurt. It hurt so bad first use on my legs. I couldn't finish. And I have high pain tolerance. I mean I've been shot in the arm and didn't cry once. Just to describe the kinda pain I've been through. So this does hurt. I originally bought this mostly for my arm pits.... hell no.... my arm pits bleeds when I use this. But I'm still trying.... I'm not giving up. And so now I can sorta do a quick swift on my arm pit and not scream lol. So I'm making progress and maybe one day I'll be able to use it on my arm pits. But not today that's for sure. I haven't even thought to use this &#34;down below&#34;.... no way.... closest I've done was my belly and that wasn't as bad as I thought. So all in all it does in fact work. I do feel it pulling hairs and I see all lot of hair on the epilator when I'm done. I wish I can insert a pic so u can see the before and after. It doesn't give me smooth legs... but it does pull my hairs and d my hairs are thinner and lighter and easier to pull after each use. I do think it's worth it. Expecially for this price. If your still worry just go to target and did get a cheap 20 dollar epilator and test to see if you like it. Me on the other hand am to cheap and rather risk it. I love the trimmer it comes with.   141. I think experiences with this product are going to vary wildly depending on the type of hair and skin each person has, so I'll start by saying that I have extremely sensitive skin, prone to razor-burn and ingrown hairs, plus my hair tends to grow back at an very fast rate, so I am probably not an ideal candidate for epilation. Also used this for my legs, I haven't yet tried it on my armpits or bikini line.<br /><br />First, yes, it's painful; but I'm a big baby about pain, and I was able to stick it out, so I think most people can handle it.<br /><br />Second, this is not a use-once-a-month-and-forget-it tool. Hair grows back fast enough that I have to do touch-ups with it every single day. However the regrowth is sporadic, so it's not really bad doing the daily maintenance.<br /><br />Third, my legs are not nearly as smooth as after a close shave. Most hairs are plucked, but some will be clipped instead, plus there are always some that are too short for the tool to grab. No matter how much time I take, I always still have a bit of stubbly texture left behind. Not nearly as prickly as shaving stubble, but definitely not silky smooth. I also have to use the tool at night before bed rather than in the morning, as my legs will be covered with little red welts from the plucking for a few hours after using it.<br /><br />Overall, I have been using this for almost a year, and I think I prefer it to shaving, but only because my razor burn was painful and unsightly. This is no great solution, but it's better than razors for someone with skin as bad as mine. At least until I can afford laser treatments.

  166. I wanted the Braun Silk-Epil 7681 epilator for facial hair. I found that in this Braun. I had tried other types in the past with the little tweezers, etc and they were either painful, extremely noisy or practically ineffective.<br /><br />I wanted something that would work on the upper lip as well as the chin area. I wanted something with the least amount of pain and followup redness and/or rash as possible.<br /><br />The first couple of times using the Braun I was hesitant and didn't hold it the right way and kept missing hairs, but I finally got the hang of it. I do not have to use it every day, just when I feel the growth. I will say that the hairs that do grow back in are not as prolific or seem to be as dark as when I just used an electric shaver. Maybe I just think they are not, but the Braun definitely makes it easier to deal with the growth.<br /><br />As for the discomfort, well, it's not like just using an electric shaver by any means, but the end result is worth the mild discomfort and you get used to it.<br /><br />For what I wanted the Braun for, I am quite satisfied.   167. Absolutely LOVE this thing! I bought it after deciding that waxing wasn't worth it because it doesn't last long enough, plucking takes too long (& destroys my armpits in the process), & shaving wasn't cutting it (pun not intended lol)! Waxing only lasts for a week with me; I don't know, but my armpit hair just refuses to chill out. Plucking takes forever & made my armpits unbareable sore. Shaving leaves a shadow from the root of the hair under my skin; I hate that shadow, so I decided to epilate.<br /><br />In the interest of full disclosure, epilating is like no other pain I've felt! I'm not saying that to scare you, I'm saying that so you're aware! If you shave, obviously that's not a pain. Waxing doesn't hurt as bad as this because everything's being taken out at once, whereas this device takes out each hair one by one. & you feel EVERY pluck! Plucking doesn't really hurt to me, so it's nothing compared to this.<br /><br />The pain of epilating is more like a very quick, shocking sting. This is my first epilator, so I didn't know what to think; honestly, the pain caught me off guard. It's a quick sting in the smallest portion of skin possible. You'd think pain like this couldn't be possible, but after using this I'm certain ants feel everything when you squash them, it doesn't matter how small something is; it will feel the pain. Yeah, this epilator brought new insights lol!<br /><br />Anywho, I TRULY recommend using this on wet skin! You want to shower & exfoliate before using this, so your skin is softer & hair removal is easier. You want to use a shave creme doesn't lather; if you use one that lathers, your armpits will sting the life out of you. I use the Coochi Shave System & have been for years. This shave creme moisturizes your skin & protects it, so there's no itching/irritation after shaving. At all!<br /><br />I also recommend using the slowest speed if this is your first time epilating. Also make sure your device is charged. Other than all of that, I love this thing!<br /><br />I HIGHLY recommend!ove this thing!<br /><br />I HIGHLY recommend!

I use it on my legs, as a brazilian hair remover, bikini area, armpits, peach fuzz on the face, the trail line on my stomach and to remove peach fuzz on my chest.<br /><br />The first time using the epilator it is really really painful. No pain, no gain, right? After the first time, the hair grows back so thin and sparse that it is very easy and much less painful to maintain. The first time you epilate you don't get all the hairs, however over time it feels like you're practically hairless! Again, the hair grows back much much thinner. My electrolysis was against tweezing, however I have not had any issues with it other than needing to maintain redness or bumpiness after using the Braun Silk-epil 7. But the redness and bumpiness would happen with any epilator.<br /><br />This product is a $100 investment and makes managing hair 100 times better. I wish I would have known about this product sooner!!
  174. Not suitable for those with course hair as ingrown hairs are an issue if the hairs are not removed from the root and it has to be used weekly. Not all of the hairs are taken out by the root. Some break off and have to grow back, requiring the user to treat a area weekly. You're better off waxing if you want lasting results.
  175. Love it! Definitely get it! It's easy to use and made with great quality!
  176. Before I bought this item I was a regular waxer. My hair grows fast and it is dark, plus I have sensitive skin so I am prone to irritation from shaving and get ingrown hairs easily. I figured I'd try it and if it totally sucked I could always return it.<br />I have found I like this product a lot. The pain for using the epilator is easier for me to handle than waxing. I can go at my own pace, I don't have to take time out of my day to get waxed, I have kids so it's nice to be able to use the Silk-epil when it's convent for me rather than having to take time to go all the way to my esthetician. I can epilate in the privacy and comfort of my own home and I have saved a TON of money. It has already paid for itself in less than a month. I use it on my legs, underarms and bikini line and it takes me just under 30 minutes to do all three. I tried to use it on my lip but it was too painful.<br />The only reason that I didn't give it a full five stars is because I wish I could do my lip too and it is hard to get my knees really good.<br />If you are used to waxing you should try it. If you usually shave it might take you a little bit to adjust to it.

I do not use it on my face so I really don't care as much but still a disappointing fixture.<br />I have not used it under water but I do like the fact that I can wash it under running water. It is so much easy to keep it clean.<br />The battery do last fairly long but if you are not done and it runs out you can not use it plug (in case some dummy tries to immerse it while plug…) Also, I wonder if the battery life is going to decay and then you can not even use it plugging it in…<br />On the other hand I like how I can just go sit some where which good light to use it without having to worry about plugging it in.<br />I do not think is faster than the one purchased 5 years ago.<br />I do not like the wheel they put to turn it on and off, some times I need to use my 2 hand to turn it on or off, just not fast enough (I was very used to the other switch.)<br />I do like the light, my first one did not have a light but my second one did.   182. This epilator has some nice features - it's easy to hold, the light is bright so you can see each hair and the massage head really cuts down on the pain. However, I do find myself having to repeatedly go over the same area as the tweezers seem to miss a lot. Also, this product claims to be able to grip a hair the size of a grain of sand - in my experience that is absolutely not true. As previously stated, it consistently misses hairs much longer than a grain of sand. Overall, I would say this epilator is okay, but honestly if I had a to-do I would buy a different one.
  183. I did some research to determine which epilator was the best for what I wanted to do with it and while expensive, I feel the Braun SE7 is well worth the money.<br />Today was my first time ever using an epilator and it was great! I did legs and bikini line dry, not in the shower.<br /><br />Left leg:<br />-I just used the epilator with the efficiency head, did not use the included Pre-Epilation towelettes.<br />-It took me a bit to get the speed and direction down to get the best results. Don't push too hard, that is counter productive.<br />-felt like tiny pinpricks or a bunch of static shocks all at once but really not terrible<br />-mild irritation visible but it went away within the hour<br /><br />Right Leg<br />-I tried the towelettes and efficiency head, didn't notice any sensation difference, they smell nice though.<br />-switched to the massaging head and really felt a difference. It tricks you into not feeling the pain as much. I like the massaging head best. It definitely decreased the unpleasantness<br /><br />Bikini line<br />-overall unplesant, longer hairs are no good, trim those things with the shaving head beforehand!<br />-again the massaging head was more comfortable.<br />-a few blood spots but way less than waxing would produce<br />-silky smooth results, 100% better than shaving<br /><br />It comes with a little bag to carry all the heads and accessories. Great product, why I went so many years not knowing this existed is a mystery. You'd think they'd be more prevalant<br /><br />I haven't tried underarms yet, will update when I do
  184. The Braun Se7681 Silk-Epil 7681 Wet and Dry Epilator is a convenient tool to have in your arsenal for your war on stray hairs! It plucks even very short hairs, leaving behind smooth skin.<br /><br />This epilator has a light, which makes it easier to view the areas you're working on, and a wet/dry feature as well. I did find that the epilator works better when dry, but it feels better when used wet, so it is nice to have the option to use it both ways.<br /><br />The various caps for the epilator increase its usefulness tremendously. I especially like that it also functions as a shaver, because, lets face it, even if it does come with a special attachment for the job, pulling hair in \\"sensitive areas\\" is not that fun.
  185. Using this Braun Silk-Epil was my first time using an epilator. I was not exactly sure what to expect but was excited by all of the other reviews I read where people talked about not having to use it that often to maintain hairless legs.<br /><br />The first time I used it on my legs, it was very painful and it left my legs with red dots wherever a hair was removed. Those red dots stuck around for about a day. The more I have used it over the last month though, the less irritated my skin is after use (I may get a little redness but it goes away within hours) and it is less painful too.<br /><br />I really like that you can use it dry and that is my preference because it means I do not have to fit it into my normal shower time (I have two young kids so sometimes I don't have the luxury of long showers!) I also am a big fan of the light on it... even in a well lit room, it helps show you where hairs are.<br /><br />The negatives would be how painful it is on other body parts. I tried this epilator on my armpits and could not handle the pain (or the burning that lasted for days afterwards). I will stick to a razor for that! Also, I read reviews that said you only need to use it every couple of weeks but I find myself using it every couple of days.<br /><br />Overall, I am impressed with the product and enjoy using it for hair removal on my legs.
  186. This is the best epilator ever, it is incredibly versatile. The different attachments are perfect for whatever part of your body you need to keep smooth and hairless. This is the second epilator I own, the first was a Remington. And so far this one is my favorite. It is very efficient, and it is not as loud as the other one I had. Would totally recomend this.
  187. This epilator is the 5th one I've owned. Yes, it's spendy, but it's also the first epilator that was able to grab the pale blonde super fine hairs on my legs (using the Express Head). It hurts, like someone snapping a rubber band against my skin, but hey, it gets those fine hairs! I mostly use epilators on my underarm hair though... if I shave there those hairs grow back stubbly and irritate my sensitive underarm skin. If instead I epilate there, then the hairs grow back very fine and not itchy. This epilator does a great job on my underarms.<br /><br />I only epilate dry, but being able to rinse this epilator under water to clean it is VERY nice.<br /><br />If you're new to epilators, I would suggest shaving, then using the epilator. This way you'll grab only the few hairs you missed which will make it much more tolerable. Then the next day, epilate again. And so forth. It'll take a week to get them all but I think it's the best way to ease into it as it hurts less with shorter hairs. Doing all the hair at once can be too much to bear unless you've got crazy pain tolerance.<br /><br />*NOTE* It's best to always use an epilator on clean skin only. No lotion, no body oil! The lotion or oil will get on those epilator grabbers and they're not able to grab hairs as well any more.

I would recommend dry brushing and doing a body scrub :)<br /><br />I like it best for the underarms honestly. It is painful (of course) but you get used to it and it lasts a long time (relative to your hair growth cycle). When you shave you very quickly have the dark colouration that comes from regrowth of the hair. When you epilate, the entire hair is removed by the root and so you don't have that dark colouration of your armpits until the entire new hairs start to grow in.<br /><br />Altogether, I do like this product. It lasts longer than shaving and teaches you to just suck up the pain. All of the little attachments are great, but I usually just use the &#34;vibrating&#34; one on.

It takes care of my problems, though I have to use it every other day. Not a big deal considering I was tweezing every day. It does leave my skin smooth and cuts down on my morning grooming time. I will say it hurts, and still hurts after several months of use. It hurts the worse on the upper lip, but it is only momentary and goes away quickly. The pain is worth the results. This does have problems pulling out course hair, but that is probably due to the fact that it is hard to pull the skin tight in some areas. I give it 4 stars because of how frequently I have to use the product. Overall I see a HUGE improvement
  246. Initially, I was fairly happy with this epilator. However, after about two months of ownership the power switch in the unit failed and the device acquired a mind of it's own. If it had a charge, it could turn itself on at any time, and when it did, it would be impossible to shut off. I contacted Braun about the issue, I will have to mail the unit to a repair center at my expense and the turnaround time will likely be several weeks. I'm not impressed, and I regret making this purchase.
  247.   248. I use this all the time, it is super good. It removes even the shortest hairs. The first time it feels like your skin is burning, but from the on the pain diminishes. Hairs don't grow until after 4 or more weeks, and when they start growing they are usually more fine and in less quantity

  256. I've been using a Braun Silk Epil for years on my legs, but could never use it under my arms because it was so painful. I had to shave, and I hate shaving. When I got this new model, I tried it again, and success!<br /><br />It's still going to be painful as heck, so it's important to approach it the right way.<br />1. Shave the day before. Don't make the mistake I did and think the hair needs to be longer. That's how I ended up with an epilator dangling from my armpit.<br />2. Epilate in the shower, with your arm stretched behind your head and the water hitting your armpit. This reduces the pain from &#34;I'M BEING FLAYED ALIVE&#34; levels to &#34;Ow ow ow!&#34; levels.<br />3. Don't do it all at once. It's going to HURT A LOT at first, and you might even bleed a tiny bit, so do small sessions every day to keep from being overwhelmed.<br />4. Epilate often. Once you've gotten rid of the hair, you can just do five second touch ups in the shower to catch hairs as they grow back.<br /><br />Take heart! Once you're in the maintenance phase, it barely hurts at all, and that's what makes it so great. I love that I can spend a total of five minutes a month on my underarms and have zero stubble. I also find this model is better at catching tiny hairs on my legs, and the light is very helpful.<br /><br />Things I'd change:<br />I wish there was an easy way to clean the epilator head; I have long hair and stray hairs get hopelessly wrapped around it.<br />I also don't like that you can't use the epilator while it's charging. I guess this is to discourage people from bringing the epilator into the shower while it's plugged in, but come on, is anyone that silly? The battery doesn't last much more than 20 minutes on high, and that's not enough when I'm weedwhacking legs I neglected over the winter.<br /><br />I hate shaving and stubble, I'm too blonde for lasers, and waxing doesn't last me more than a week. Unfortunately I'm not self-confident enough to go around with hairy legs and underarms, so this epilator has made my life much, much easier.s and underarms, so this epilator has made my life much, much easier.

  258. Epilators by BRAUN are really the best out there. I've been using them for about 15 years on my legs, and they do an amazing job. This one is probably my 5th Braun epilator since I started using them so you know they last for a while. German quality still means a lot I guess.

  262. This worked much better than I expected and much better than the old one. Legs stay smoother for at least a week!
  263. I had previously used the Silk Epil 5 and stopped using it because it was too painful. I once again tired of shaving, and decided to try this one since it could be used in water. I'm glad, because the ability to use it in water makes a HUGE difference. Hot water relaxes your skin and lets the hair pull out much easier. Keep in mind that I'm a guy and have a LOT of thick hair on my legs, probably more than most of the people interested in this product. There is a huge difference in the amount of pain compared to the Silk Epil 5, which could only be used on dry skin. I ran a bath tonight and sat with my legs submerged while using the machine, and it took me about 15 minutes to do both legs.<br /><br />To use this without getting ingrown hairs, you HAVE to exfoliate. I use a pumice stone, and immediately after epilation, use an anti-microbial soap (Dial for example) to prevent staph infections of the hair follicles. Staph is all over your skin, and given the opportunity, will infect your hair follicles and cause something similar to razor bumps, though razor bumps are often cause by sharp hair pressing into the side of the follicle as well as staph. So I scrub my skin with Dial and the pumice stone so the exfoliation action lets the soap reach a little further into the follicle where it can kill any microbial agents. After waiting for a minute or two without washing of the soap, I rinse and use a moisturizing body wash to replace some of the moisture drawn out by the soap. It keeps me from having problems when the hair grows back. It also helps to have about 3-5 days of growth so the tweezers actually have something to grasp, which also helps to minimize the amount of hair that gets broken rather than pulled. The result is, minus a few stragglers, perfectly smooth legs for about two weeks (depending on how fast your hair grows of course). When the hair is long enough to start showing again, it looks like the growth is thinner, but it's really just that your hair is regrowing with a tapered point as it naturally does and not a sharp, thick end that shaving causes, so even regrowth feels smoother than it does when you shave.<br /><br />If you can handle a little pain, buy this, because it will save you loads of time and money that would have been spent on razors and cream. I epilate once every week and a half or two, where I was shaving at least every other day.
  264. im in love with this! ..the first few times i tried to use it id turn it on and get scared and turn it back off..but then i finally decided to stop being so scared of it...i did the front of my lower right leg, and it surprisingly didn't hurt, until i got to the back part and i had to stop..but the next day i figured id give it another try, it hurt but i kept going...when i did my left lower leg i realized i was just whizzing right through it...it wasn't hurting or anything..and my legs were silky smooth...its been a few days now and i feel the hair starting to grow back out but the manual says for the first month to use it once a wk...so thats what I'm going to do...i also tried it on other part of my body (actually a little everywhere except my face) and i have to say...it hurts least on the legs below the knee....but I'm going to keep using it everyday or every other day on different parts of my body until i become fully comfortable with it,..because although its a pain, the results are beautiful and amazing!!! ..definitely 5 stars and more :D As for the battery life....i don't find it tooo big of an issue...

If you're used to waxing, this is not so bad. Razors make your legs smoother though, since the epilator cannot get the super short, micro hairs. The epilator will get rid of 99% of the visible hairs, but if you run your hand over the skin, you can still feel tiny hairs there. Overall, I'm happy with this product.

  279. I primarily wanted something that would remove hair nicely before attempting laser hair removal in my armpit area so I purchased this product. It definitely takes time to get used, and have not yet used it on my armpits. I think it works well for legs, and arm hair. When it comes to the face, it's fair. The epilator takes time getting used to for those who haven't used it before. And if you're like me, a tough tomboy who is still progressing to learn about female grooming, this review is for you.<br /><br />- Be very gentle as in VERY GENTLE when you bring the epilator to your skin. When I first tried it to my armpits, I immediately aimed for myself thinking I was being careful enough, and the device pulled in my skin! I was like, &#34;DAMNNNNNN, this shit hurts!&#34; I still haven't gotten used to it for my armpits. The motion of a device plucking hairs out of your body is sharp. If you've ever used tweezers for your armpits, it's that feeling times 10.<br />- I spent a lot of money on the thing, so I was planning on returning it. But before I did, I thought I give it another shot; only this time not in my armpit area.<br />- I used it for my arm hair, my legs, and my face. I still use tweezers to manually pluck for my eye brows. When I used the epilator on my face, I used it to pull out the hairs on each side of my face that were growing out like side burns. It hurt, but definitely no big deal compared to armpit area. I liked that it came with a precision top to help epilate narrow areas of hair.<br /><br />- Gently &#34;Gliding&#34; the epilator along your arm works great. Now I went on youtube to see how this works, and I saw women who were so used to the epilator make it look easy. But if you're a beginner I know this will happen at least once, If you carelessly or think you're being careful enough at how you TILT or AIM the epilator at your skin then think again before contact. You can actually get your skin caught in the motor of blades and get pinched. Now I'm warning you of this because I was unaware such a device could do such a thing thinking, &#34;this should be easy&#34;. Since I consider myself to be tough, the pinching was not as bad as not knowing it could happen. Not knowing, along with the pinching, can be quite startling.<br /><br />- My legs don't grow out too hairy or too thick although I shave. So using the epilator for them is kind of annoying when shaving is a lot faster and quieter. Of course the purpose of the epilator is to remove hair from it's root so it doesn't grow back as fast. So that's nice, but again I'm a bit of a tomboy, so even if I do have hairy legs, I don't worry about it. From far away, people can't see the hair! lol<br /><br />-After bypassing how you control your epilator, it then becomes &#34;easy to use&#34;.<br /><br />Still haven't aimed for armpits, yet. And it will take some time before I attempt laser surgery. For now, shaving the armpit area with a nice minty foam is good enough, until I make my way using the epilator for that area again. Though, it's almost crazy to think people put themselves through that type of pain.<br /><br />Anyway, I hope this review helps.

  309. Wow! I bought this product because I was trying out a different product where you are supposed to epilate before you use it, and I didn't like that product's epilator attatchment. I wanted to find a better one, so I did some research and purchased this epilator. I have to say it is like night and day between this epilator and every other one I have ever tried! I love that I can use it in the bath! My skin loves this! I have used an epilator on my legs, but with my legs wet, it makes a huge difference - there was no pain at all! My tops of my feet are sensitive, but wet, no problem. It comes with multiple heads, including underarm and upper lip, and so I tried the underarm head, which I have never tried before, since I tend to have sensitive skin - no pain there either! Not only can I finally use an epilator on the areas I want, without pain, it also gets the fine hairs that others do not catch! This pulls fine hairs, practically flush to my skin. AND on top of that, the head rotates, so it is super easy to keep it flush, unlike other epilators. There are two heads for your general wide area (legs) use, one with massagers and the other with grooves that lift the hairs. I tried and liked both, but liked the massager head better - it lifts the hairs and provides some extra gentle skin surface stimulation. Both of the large heads rotate. It also comes with the underarm/bikini head, upper lip head, and a whole set of shaver attatchments which I did not use, since I bought it in order to epilate. Oh, and it also has a light that turns on when you are running the unit, that lights up the area you are using it on, so you can see any hairs left and go over the area again. This light shines on the area where you are epilating, NOT in your eyes. Very helpful! I am totally spoiled now, never going back to any other epilator. I love this thing! My skin is so smooooth! Thank you so much, whoever invented it! Oh, and the 40 minute charge was plenty of time for me to do my legs and underarms.

  311. My husband (African American) bought this in an attempt to find a cure for the ingrown hairs he would get from shaving every day. He thought he would use this to epilate one a week or so and not have to shave in-between--giving his skin a chance to heal from the daily shaving that is required in the military.<br /><br />Since there is a lady pictured on the cover, he decided he would let me test it out on my legs before he gave it a go. It hurt like the dickens and I gave up after about 5 minutes. Not only that, but I got ingrown hairs as a result on using it despite going in afterwards and exfoliating quite vigorously. Granted, I didn't try it long term, so perhaps it gets better with time, but I much prefer to not spend my nights crying while I epilate my legs.<br /><br />Use on Face by Husband:<br />After my husband saw me wincing in pain, he wrote it off as me being a pansy and decided to man up and take on the whiskers that covered his face and neck. In a show of machismo, he got halfway through his face, gritting his teeth the entire way through, trying not to let the tears stream down his face as he grimaced with pain. He never used it again, although he later shared that he had strongly considered getting drunk enough that he wouldn't feel the pain of it, but was afraid that he would somehow rip off half of his face in his drunken state and then be all the more worse for the whole experience. The only bright side was that hubby had zero ingrown hairs--which he normally has a plethora of as a result of his electric razors. So now if he could only bare the pain, he could have that silky smooth skin he had always dreamed of.

  329. First off, I have to say, that I am not new to epilation in general, nor to the BRAUN devices in particular. I have been using an older model braun epilator for many years and I decided a while ago (after trying various other methods of hair removal) that epilation is the best option for me. It is safe to say, I knew very well what I was getting myself into and as a result I am more than happy with my purchase. Here is why:<br /><br />OVER-ALL PERFORMANCE / POWER:<br />I can see a clear improvement in performance from my old device. It feels like the Silk-epil 7 has more power and works more precisely. In short: it gets more hair at the first attempt. The various heads that come with it make it also easier to reach the area that you want, without pinching any skin or removing too much hair.<br />The light is a nice plus too, but I would not say that I can´t do without.<br /><br />CORDLESS:<br />It may not seem that important, but not being restricted by a cord is a huge plus! For some reason, the cord of my old device was alway in my way and never long enough for me to take a comfortable position. Sometimes the plug would come loose on the device and it would stop working while I was moving around to reach the back of my legs. That is finally all in the past and I am glad that I can now move around freely and unrestricted!<br /><br />WATERPROOF:<br />The one thing that always bothered me with my old device was the thought that I could not give it a real good rinse down to clean it every once in a while. While I have never used my silk-epil in the shower and probably never will, I am relieved to know that the device is waterproof and I can simply hold it under the faucet, when I am done.<br /><br />EXTRAS:<br />The device comes with a fair selection of extra heads and some epilation whips. When shopping around for a new epilator, I was not entirely sure if I would need those extras, but now that I tried it, I am actually happy to have them! As I mentioned before: The heads really help making the job easy and the whips, to my surprise, really work! I probably mostly appreciate, that the whips prevent the little red bumps that usually appear after epilation and then slowly fade within a couple of hours. Before, I had to wear long pants for the rest of the day or epilate in the evening so my skin would have enough time to regenerate. Now, there is hardly anything to see.<br /><br />BATTERY LIFE:<br />I have read a couple of reviews prior to my purchase, where people had trouble with battery life. I can honestly say, that this was never a problem for me. I am actually impressed with how long a battery charge lasts. After reading those reviews I expected to have to plug it in after every use, while in fact, I can use it a couple of times before it runs out of power.<br /><br />Over all, I would recommend this to every one who is looking into buying an epilator. I must say though, that epilation simply is not for everyone. After years of using this method, my hair grow is very moderate and so is the level of discomfort when using this device. For someone who is new to epilation it is probably different and it might take a little getting used to and maybe even a bit of practice to handle the device with maximum results.<br />I did recommend this device to one of my friends who had never used an epilator in her life and she seems to be very happy with her purchase. Generally, I would say, if you can handle hot wax, you can handle this.

This is the stuff that I'm sure will be used in the future to extract information from the bad guys. I did, however, continue and with continuing I realized that the pain was mostly in my mind and I did get used to it. I applied coconut oil afterwards to the freshly epilated area. Please don't respond and tell me that coconut oil is the absolute worst thing to apply...I don't want to know at this point. I will say that in the morning the redness was gone and it's so soft! I will be epilating from now until my 90s. It may take a care giver to do it for me at that time, but I am completely sold on it!<br /><br />Update September 28, 2013- I am still loving this epilator. Now after using it for some time I can say how pleased that I am with the fact the my underarms are so soft and don't show all of the dark bumps from regrowth. I also love how I only need to use it a couple of times per week to keep up with the new growth. It's fast and my skin is used to it so it doesn't hurt. I'm so glad I didn't quit after my first experience. Totally worth it!
  375. I love the new Braun silk epil!! It does a much faster and efficient job. We have to remember to charge it before using, Becoz it only works wirelessly.
  376. It's not perfect but pretty darn close.

  384. I recently bought this and I'm so happy I did. I have very sensitive skin with coarse dark hair. I have to shave my legs every day and I still end up with sharp irritating stubble. The upside is that I have a decent tolerance for pain, which led me to discover epilating.<br /><br />I am new to epilating, however I am no stranger to ripping my hair out at the root for a smooth and long lasting finish. I have had my legs, underarms, and Brazilian waxed at a salon as well as at home by yours truly. I have also grown tired of the at home wax clean up and broke by spending a small fortune for continuous trips to the salon for hit or miss results (my personal estethician only does the most amazing brazilians so for other parts of me I'm at another persons mercy). So after some extensive research I decided to try epilating and I'm hooked!<br /><br />I am a prime member so for $3 I had it FedEx delivered next day. I prepped myself (or rather didn't prep myself) for this experience by letting my hair grow on my legs and under arms for about a week. Yes, it was super glorious in this 90 degree weather but that is an experience of it's own. I plugged in my Braun 7, and in the time it took for me to have breakfast and clean up the house it was fully charged. I started on my right leg with the massager attachment, and with short but slow strokes cleared a hairless path through my leg jungle in about 4 passes. AMAZZZING!!!<br /><br />The sensation is literally like small prickly needles tapping into your skin, but it is over immediately. No lingering pain or the risk of burning or scratches like shaving or waxing. The trick is short strokes, taught skin, and small areas. Midway through, I abandoned the massager cap for the efficiency cap and was able to finish both legs in a bit over an hour (I did have to break to recharge but keep in mind I was working through a small man worthy forest!) The light is a huge help as well to point out visible loners that resisted, but they didn't stand a chance. I tried to do my inner upper thigh just outside the bikini area, but it was a no go. I will probably have to get it waxed with a Brazilian and maintain it with the Epilator. It was too painful for the amount of hair that had grown out. Kudos to the girls who can use it to deforest the neither regions. It's not happening here!<br /><br />Soon after my legs, I decided to try my armpits. But I wanted to test out the wet feature. So after a shower, along with the under arm attachment, under running water I began. CRAAAPPPP!!!! The pits are the pits. My underarms have some of the coarsest textured hair on my body :( I felt like it wasn't catching the hairs fully, only tugging them painfully without getting them out. And they were so dry from neglect and harsh deodorant that the water seemed to just bead up rather than aid in the process. I needed my pits to allow the Epilator to glide over them and do its thing. So I lathered on a bit of Dr. Bronners bar soap (the liquid one is too drying for me) and BINGO!!! My gnarly pit hair seemed to be charmed right on out of their comfy little pore homes. I think that is the secret to under arms, keeping them slick and a lubed up. In five minutes both puts were clean.<br /><br />So my final recap:<br /><br />Pros:<br />Short charging time<br />Truly pulls from the root<br />Easily dissembles for cleaning<br />Light feature<br />Different caps<br /><br />Cons:<br />Ouch!<br />Wish it held a charge longer than about 45 min<br /><br />At the end of this experience I was a bit welted (as I would be after waxing) so I popped a couple Advil and now in the morning I'm all good. I plan on exfoliating with my clarisonic pro body brush and will do an updated review to share the longevity of my results. But so far I'm a likin!

  393. This is an outstanding product. I first began using epilators a couple of months ago, and this one is my favorite so far. It is much more efficient at removing hair than the other brands I have tried, and it is also faster. As a person who positively despises shaving, this product has been a godsend for me. I also love that it comes with an attachment for shaving as well (it comes with several other attachments too, but I'm not sure that I'll be using them). The only thing I do not like about it so far is that you cannot use it while it is plugged in to charge. I understand it is for safety purposes since you can use the epilator in water, but it really bothers me because I don't think I'll ever be using this in the bath or shower. Therefore, I wish they would make a dry-only version of this product. Overall, I would absolutely recommend this product to anyone looking for a great alternative to shaving.<br /><br />A few notes for first-time epilator-users considering this product (or any other epilator):<br /><br />- Epilating is painful, but it isn't unbearable. You will certainly get used to it over time.<br />- Epilating is time-consuming when you're first starting out (it definitely takes longer than shaving), but your results will last much longer. I do not see my hair start to grow back until about two weeks after epilating.<br />- The places where I have seen the absolute best results from epilating are around my bikini line and my underarms. Seriously, you will never see those areas look so smooth and irritation-free for so long! It's absolutely amazing!<br />- If you're consistent with epilating, you will see less hair regrowth over time.

My disappointment is due to the following: 1) the cordless model isn't nearly as powerful as the corded models that I've had in the past and the motor has very little momentum 2) due to #1, I find that it doesn't remove the hair as well and my hair grows back much quicker than it did with my corded model 3) it's very ineffective on underarm hair and I actually have to remove the cover piece completely in order to remove underarm hair. Unfortunately, it's too late for me to return this item, but I needed the time to test it out and see how it worked. Now I know and I will likely spend more money to replace this because using it feels like a wasted effort. My recommendation is to stick to a corded epilator (Braun or other brands).   434. I actually never knew what an epilator was until my friend told me about hers. Being a waxer/plucker the epilator sounded like an amazing product, and it is! After a bit of research I decided on buying this model.<br /><br />The device is beautiful, white and sparkly. When being held you can tell immediately that it is a well-built epilator. After using it about 4-5 times it's truly an efficient product! It grabs even the finest hairs you don't really notice, it does a good job grabbing the smaller hairs just poking out. However, you might have to go over short hair areas a couple times. One of the issues I have with the epilator is that the light turns on every time you start the epilator. I would like if I had the option of switching it on since I don't always need it on and it just wastes the battery. Despite that, the light is still useful at putting the smaller hairs in view. My hair grows back within 2ish weeks. Hair growth really depends on the person, also it's important to remember that the cell hair growths are all in different cycles.<br />In terms of power, I haven't had an issue with it yet. I get what I need done with it still having juice. The caps that this comes with is not all useful, to me at least. I only use the main one along with the efficiency cap. I tried the facial cap but it really didn't pick up anything, the cap I feel is too thick for the tweezers to reach the hairs. Shaver head and trimmer head are useful if you like to shave and keep places trimmed. The main cap just gets things done quicker and to me less painful than the efficiency cap. If you just want to epilate quickly use the efficiency cap, the cap is a lot thinner so the tweezers are able to reach the hairs better. Cleaning is simple with a handy dandy little brush and you could even wash the hairs off. I've used the epilator in my shower before and it works with hairs that are a bit longer but not extremely well since hairs stick to the skin.<br />*I haven't used it in the bath, but I think a useful tip is to submerge the area you want in water and epilate it underwater, that way the hairs aren't sticking to your skin and are lifted up by the water.<br />If you haven't waxed or plucked your hairs before then it will hurt. How much? it depends on your pain tolerance, but keep in mind after a few uses it will hurt but gradually you will be able to tolerate the pain. The most painful spot for me is doing my upper lip, but I'm starting to get use to it. It will be red for a few hours so I would recommend epilating at night before bed.<br /><br />All in all, I would recommend this product. It works, it's efficient and looks like it will last for a long time!th, but I think a useful tip is to submerge the area you want in water and epilate it underwater, that way the hairs aren't sticking to your skin and are lifted up by the water.<br />If you haven't waxed or plucked your hairs before then it will hurt. How much? it depends on your pain tolerance, but keep in mind after a few uses it will hurt but gradually you will be able to tolerate the pain. The most painful spot for me is doing my upper lip, but I'm starting to get use to it. It will be red for a few hours so I would recommend epilating at night before bed.<br /><br />All in all, I would recommend this product. It works, it's efficient and looks like it will last for a long time!

The present charging point is useful in US only.<br /><br />Now here's my wife's experience with the product:<br /><br />&#34;I've been using it for the last 4 years; the shaving head is perfect and absolutely doesn't harm the skin... However, I've been using the tweezers on my legs below the knees and I found it relatively efficient as long as it concerns the looks (you can get the smooth feeling only when you use a pin to pull out the ingrown hairs). The first time hurts but then, as the hairs don't grow all at once, they become weaker and easier to remove.<br /><br />Nevertheless, some hairs end up cut rather than plucked so I used it almost every other day. The thing which I didn't like was that I started having many ingrown hairs in the deepest layer of my skin looking like small white greyish spots, which I kept on squeezing until they bled, bcoz you can't take them out with a pin like you do the normal ingrown hairs, and they left white marks as you can see in the pics attached. I think it would take time for these spots to vanish.... I've heard this problem from many people using the tweezers as well.<br /><br />I've never used it in the bathroom so can't say anything about that. The battery lasts for about half an hour, more or less. and it charges within an hour or so. The performance is perfect till now.. hope you guys find this helpful!

  453. For those of us who have never used an epilator before, this model is a great one to start with. It has massaging heads and various other features (such as the ability to use it in the bath) that are designed to make epilation less painful. That said, holeeeee cow! Epilation the first time is painful! The second time is MUCH less painful, if you keep the epilation up and do it every month or so.<br /><br />Here are some tips to make your first epilation as comfortable as possible:<br />1. Shave right now! As soon as you order this device, so that when you get it you will only have short hairs. Just like in waxing, long hairs are brutally painful. And if your hair hasn't grown out much by the time you get it, great! You will be able to epilate gradually as your hair grows in... Just epilate every two or three days for a week or two to catch all the hairs as they grow in. That would be so much less painful than the way I did it: going after long hairs and short all at once.<br />2. Get yourself some tasty sweets. Studies have shown that sweets on the tongue actually reduce the sensation of pain.<br />3. Don't use any of the optional caps if you're doing your legs. They won't help.<br /><br />I did a very careful study of all do the models available on amazon.com and this one had every single useful feature available except one: you cannot use shave gel or cream with it when you are using it under water or in the shower. To me, it was worth the trade off to get the massaging head.<br /><br />I highly recommend epilation now as a hair removal method because (after the first one), it is less painful, less expensive and more convenient than waxing. It lasts much longer than shaving and you never get nicks or cuts.<br /><br />I recommend the Braun Silk Epil 7 because it is loaded with every single feature but one that you could ever want in an epilator. And so far, the quality is good. I will change my review if anything bad happens in its performance.

If you are a chicken for pain, you may want to tweeze or wax the area first, and use this device on it next time around because it picks each hair individually, and that seems to magnify pain for each tiny spot - can be very irritating if you are not used to it. It does do an excellent job and picks out literally everything, so you never have to endure the &#34;prickly ugly stage&#34; waiting for hair to be long enough to be able to get rid of it.

  475. Honestly and undoubtedly, epilating is the equivalent of a thousand bee stings.<br /><br />For first timers, if you're hesitant just looking at it, don't get it. If you're very \\"eh\\" and want to try it out because shaving legs is just a pain in the rear but are willing to take a chance, then go for it. I'm not going to put the pain within this product, because all epilators do the exact same thing: rip your hair out with the root. I can't be convinced that more/less tweezers would aid in any sort of pain de/increase. It's not the machine, it's the act and concept!<br /><br />This is my first epilator, and I don't have a high pain tolerance, I'm a regular softie, and it's UNCOMFORTABLE at first, like I said, it's like bee stings. I shaved a few days before I ordered this, and it got here about a week later, so there was a bit of growth when I started. After a while, though, you really do just get used to it. You don't grow to LIKE it, but it's bearable, and I'm sure it just gets more and more bearable the more you do it, naturally.<br /><br />The hair on my legs is a bit of a mixed bag, there are some more thicker, coarser hairs, but mostly it's light, thin hair, and I feel that there were plenty that were just broken. BUT I have never epilated before, so I expected as much, and I will keep going until my skin and hair adapt to whats going on. I tried it on my under arms, though, which is your average thick, coarse hair, and no. I got about half-way through one side, and had to stop. I will probably get around to trying it again and just do it in stages, because I like the idea of not having to worry so much about that area every 2 days, but it will take a while!!<br /><br />One specific thing I will comment on; the little \\"massage\\" head doesn't really do much. It doesn't make any sort of difference. Though, to defend it even though it is pretty useless, it is a pretty good guide to how much pressure to use while the epilator is in use. I've found that if I hold it just so it rolls against my skin, the epilation is pretty spot-on!<br /><br />Very nice epilator, in the end! I chose this one after a lengthy search, it just comes with nice features (different caps, a shaver, the wet/dry options), and it's a nice middle-ground on price.<br /><br />ETA: I epilated my legs the very first night I got it (August 26th), a few times here and there afterwards, and have since been just shaving my legs. Not that I don't love epilating, I do, really (smugface)! But I have noticed a HUGE difference in the amount of hair that is actually growing back, which makes shaving THAT much easier and makes lasts at the very least, 5 solid days before noticing it growing back; and at the most, a week.<br /><br />SO, depending mainly on what type of hairs you're growing (I think I've mentioned, the hair on my legs differs between thick and thin), epilating once initially will at the very least will definitely make a difference in how much will come back later on. In my case, over a full month and there's still minimal growth from, more than likely, the thinner hairs that weren't strong enough to be plucked out.<br /><br />Something I would really \\"recommend\\" though, is soaking at least your legs with Olive Oil after exfoliating with a good body wash. Aside from being very hydrating (I've got really dry skin in winter months, so Olive Oil is a healthy alternative), it has anti-inflammatory properties, which I've found to be super helpful with shaving (all I shave with), but more-so now from the anger that epilating has caused; in fact, after I epilated the first time and times after that, some of my pores were being stuck-up and irritated, over time and more-so most recently as I've started back with Olive Oil, they've all gone back to normal.<br /><br />Just a few things to maybe keep in mind :)the epilation is pretty spot-on! Very nice epilator, in the end! I chose this one after a lengthy search, it just comes with nice features (different caps, a shaver, the wet/dry options), and it's a nice middle-ground on price. ETA: I epilated my legs the very first night I got it (August 26th), a few times here and there afterwards, and have since been just shaving my legs. Not that I don't love epilating, I do, really (smugface)! But I have noticed a HUGE difference in the amount of hair that is actually growing back, which makes shaving THAT much easier and makes lasts at the very least, 5 solid days before noticing it growing back; and at the most, a week. SO, depending mainly on what type of hairs you're growing (I think I've mentioned, the hair on my legs differs between thick and thin), epilating once initially will at the very least will definitely make a difference in how much will come back later on. In my case, over a full month and there's still minimal growth from, more than likely, the thinner hairs that weren't strong enough to be plucked out. Something I would really \\"recommend\\" though, is soaking at least your legs with Olive Oil after exfoliating with a good body wash. Aside from being very hydrating (I've got really dry skin in winter months, so Olive Oil is a healthy alternative), it has anti-inflammatory properties, which I've found to be super helpful with shaving (all I shave with), but more-so now from the anger that epilating has caused; in fact, after I epilated the first time and times after that, some of my pores were being stuck-up and irritated, over time and more-so most recently as I've started back with Olive Oil, they've all gone back to normal. Just a few things to maybe keep in mind :)
