  495. Amazing, little pain but very tolerable and results are fabulous. Would highly recommend it. Recouped the cost in just 4 weeks
  496. Thanks Braun and Bzzagent for allowing me to review this product! I couldn't wait to try out this epilator as I was in desperate need of an upgrade from my old epilator. For those who are not familiar with epilators, the Braun series 7 epilator is one of Braun's more expensive products that has added features to make sure that the device is relatively easy and painless to use. The massaging cap and built in light make it so much easier to spot tiny hairs and epilate without too much pain. This product has two speed settings and several attachment heads that can be used depending on the area that needs to be epilated. I would recommend using the lowest setting on areas like the legs or arms, where there is generally thicker hair and more hair growth. In this way, the epilator can grab the hair from the root without breakage. So far, I have only used the sensitive area cap and the shaver cap. The razor is wonderful; you could just use this product for the razor attachment to be honest. I have never had a smoother shave! The sensitive area cap is not as effective at grabbing hairs compared to the regular epilator without a cap. I actually preferred not using a cap for my legs and bikini area. The charge lasts a fairly long time with this epilator. After plugging it into the outlet, it had full charge within an hour. After doing both my legs and armpits (approx. 40 minutes) , it was still working which was great! Overall, I am really impressed with this product! It is easy enough to use for beginners, but also advanced enough with multiple features that long time users can also enjoy it.<br /><br />Tips and Tricks for People New to Epilating:<br />- Epilating for the first time will definitely be painful, but I promise the pain will lessen after a few uses! Try numbing cream or taking a painkiller 30 minutes before epilating if you have a very low pain threshold.<br />-Exfoliate, exfoliate, exfoliate! Exfoliate with a good scrub before and after epilating to prevent ingrown hairs. This is so important. Unless you want to manually pluck every in grown hair out, you need to exfoliate.<br />-Use aloe vera gel or another type of soothing ointment after epilating. It can really calm down the redness and irritation that happens after epilation.<br />-Applying baby powder onto the areas that you are about to epilate can help dry up any excess water or residue that is left on the skin. It's easier for the device to grab dry hairs vs wet hairs.<br />-Make sure that your hair is the correct length before epilating. I think the optimal length is 2mm-5mm. When the hairs are too long, their is a lot of breakage and left over stubble, which defeats the purpose of using an epilator haha.
  497. Its great thing!! I use it first time and it amazing!!!! Now i'll never exchange it on smth else
  498. I'm a guy that got sick of the continuous bumps I got on the &#34;bend&#34; of my neck when shaving. I considered laser treatments just to get some relief. I decided to try epilating first and I'm glad I did. I would have given it five start except for these two things:<br />1. It hurts like crazy... I have to muster all of my manliness to use it on the super sensitive skin on my neck.<br />2. It doesn't grab/eliminate all hairs regardless of length first time around. One still have to eventually shave to get rid of everything.<br /><br />I first found that even when using this, it made my bumps even more monstrous and it looked like I had a rash on my neck for a week. After that week, it was nice. Soft skin and no irradiation, but this wasn't looking like it would be MY solution. I stumbled on something that made it tolerable. Use Retinol cream (OTC) after first using and a few days afterwards. This cured the bump/rash issue down to nearly nothing. This combination is the bomb for my sensitive skin on my neck. Now, if I could just get rid of the pain in the epilating process.

  508. I will start by saying that I am a 55 year old male who hates body hair. I would have to shave daily from toes to chin. I wanted to free up my grooming time some so I started looking into epilators. I purchased the Braun Silk-epil 7 and let my body hair grow out to the recommended length. I started with my toes and legs first, using the slow setting. I found the key to the best performance is to keep the skin tight and go very slow. I won't call it pain but there was discomfort, but I kept the goal in mind. I did have some red bumps on parts of my legs but they went away within a day. One week later, I could feel a little stubble on my legs so I turned it the higher speed and redid my legs. No red bumps and much less discomfort, and my legs are pretty smooth after 2 weeks. I also used it on my chest, underarms, and buttocks and as much of my back as I could reach. Some red bumps again but didn't last long. The first use on my underarms the discomfort was intense, so again, I had to keep in mind the end goal. As far as bikini line or pubes, that's pain. I am working a little at a time in this area to see if over time the pain is lessened over time. I discovered that soaking in a hot bath helps a lot, allowing the skin to relax and the hairs releasing easier. I have also found that using sesame oil after epilating reduces the red bumps quickly.
  509. I have been using SE 7781 for three years before i went to visit my sister overseas and she liked it so much that i left it for her and bought this one for me. As much as SE7781 and SE768 look alike they do perform a little bit differently.<br /><br />First of all the shaving attachment on SE7781 stopped working in a little bit over a year with very rear use. I found a replacement on a UK website for $54+Shipping. Since i did not use it that much i did not bother. It did perform well though i did not like the charging feature - i don't like to depend on the charge vs just plugging it in and using for as long as i want. It did a good job at pulling the fine hair out and the light helps a lot as well since i've using epilators for over 12 years and my hair grows really fine.<br /><br />SE7681 is even better for pulling out fine hair while being more gentle and causing less pain. But it does not such a good job with the longer hair. Also it catches skin more easily when epilating underarms or under knees - ouch.<br /><br />The bottom line - while it is not perfect and has it's cons i still find it one of the best epilator on the market and highly recommend it to newbies because the process is very painful when you switch from shaving.

A tip would be to NOT press it hard and not making slow movements. A &#34;Swoosh&#34; movement is better and makes the hair come off easy. My hair growth has considerably reduced with its usage and i just need to use it once a month now. It also makes your skin smoother than it was. I am giving it 4 stars beacuse the facial epilation head for me is not really working. I have very small and fine hairs and it pains like HELL using it on the face, a definite no-no for me. Over All a Totally worth it product!

  551. The Braun SE7681 Silk-Epil Wet and Dry Epilator is as good of an epilator as you can get. It offers an assortment of attachments to help you with the various grooming chores associated with this device. It has a built in light that is stunningly brilliant, and the battery life is excellent. This is not a picky epilator at all, it will handle even the smallest of hairs, hair so short other brands would miss them altogether. While there is a discomfort factor when using the device, until you become accustomed to it, that is a problem with the person using it, not the device itself, so if you couldn't handle eplilating on another brand, this one isn't going to be some pain-free miracle device; it's going to bother you just as much. For those that can handle the initial discomort of epilating, this is the unit to go with, hands down. It is well built, has an assortment of attachments, and the fact that it is a Braun product is reassuring that it will provide many years of trouble-free service.

  553. I put off trying this product as quite frankly, I was scared. I had never used an epilator before, except for a plain old tweezer on my face. But I hate shaving my legs, and I decided it was finally time to give it a try. Being nervous, I read all the instructions completely several times first, and that is where I got a little confused. The epilator comes with 5 different caps, and they are described in details with pictures, but I didn't realize that the device as it first stands already has a cap on it. I thought something had to go on top of what was there, and I tried in vain to put one of the other caps on, until it finally struck me it was okay to use as it was. I charged it up, which took, as it said, about an hour, and was ready to give it a try.<br /><br />I used the enclosed lotion wipes, which I wish had come in individual packets or in a resealable pack, as I think they will dry out in time. However, they seemed to work well! I did my legs, and the pain, even for this first timer, was very minimal! It felt almost just like shaving, with little tinges of pain now and then. The booklet said to go from bottom to top of the legs, and I did that, but found to really get the hair off a few spots I had to go back and forth a little. I loved the bright light, which showed me well where I still had work to do. My legs now feel smoother than I've ever felt them! And they don't hurt at all, as the booklet said sometimes happens afterward. I was quite pleased.<br /><br />I liked the little bag that came with this, to store all the pieces, although it's not really quite big enough if you are storing the recharging cord too.<br /><br />Overall, I think this is a good product. The instructions could have been a little clearer, and sometimes I think extra heads are just thrown in to make something look like it has more value. I can't see using them that much. But I do think this will be my method of choice for exfolicating in the future!
  554. I reviewed the [[ASIN:B004TL9A7U Braun 7681 Silk-Epil 7 Xpressive Pro Epilator]] last year and gave it a glowing review. When offered the [[ASIN:B0077PLNNE Braun Se7681 Silk-Epil 7681 Wet and Dry Epilator, Silver]], I assumed it would be a different product. It's basically the same epilator, but costs less than the former and it's as great a product as the first! Braun makes quality products, and this one is no exception. As I said in my first review, the epilator is a fabulous little product that can save the expense of waxing supplies, provides great results, and is less painless than waxing when done properly. A little trick learned from waxing, namely stretching the skin, also works for preventing excess discomfort while using the epilator, and this is less messy to boot. It successfully removes even fine hairs and has been wonderful in keeping the skin smoother than other approaches. The epilator arrives with various heads and some additional little moist towelettes which I have never purchased since using those included in the box. The grooming device can be used on either wet or dry skin and because it must be charged (takes about an hour) and unplugged in order to power on, there's no fear of electrocution. The power cord can be removed, so you have only the epilator in your hand with nothing extra interfering as you move the device along the part of the body being groomed. Should you want to remove hair from your body, I'd recommend the Braun epilators, regardless of which model you select. I personally would pick this over the [[ASIN:B004TL9A7U Braun 7681 Silk-Epil 7 Xpressive Pro Epilator]] and save the additional money.This product is definitely worthy of a 5 star review!

  574. I just gave birth 5 weeks ago, and my nurse told me I have a very high threshold of pain because I did it all pain med free. And, the epilator is so loud when it is on that it woke up my baby so I wasn't able to do it for a long period of time, but I didn't really want to.<br /><br />Now, it may have been that I was trying to use this on too long of hair and that is why it was so painful. I was using this on my upper leg above my knee and I had not shaved there for a while so it was a bit long. And, very painful to use this on! The epilator also left red blotches everywhere it removed a hair follicle and it remained red until the next day so I had tiny red razor burn looking dots all over my leg.<br /><br />In the long run after using it a couple times, I am not sure I am a epilator type a girl. I don't know why I can do a natural birth but I cringe in pain when I use this!
  575. I hate shaving with a passion. I have never shaved any surface of my body before in my life, only wax. But waxing takes a long time (takes me an hour just to do my legs) and it's frustrating having to wax the underarms for I feel like I'm just wasting wax strips.<br /><br />The solution to my problems? This epilator.<br /><br />I was hesitant at first to spend so much money on one appliance, but at the coaxing and encouragement of those that had it, I eventually bought it. And it has been one of the best decisions I've made in my life.<br /><br />I did a lot of research into which brand and model to go for. And eventually I went for this one. Personally, I never use the wet option because I can barely see anything in the shower and it doesn't really epilate as well and I never use any of the other 'heads' except for the main one. But I still love it.<br /><br />The pain is minimal, unless you're doing the bikini area or towards the upper thighs. But still bearable. Get it. Get a Braun's epilator. Do it. You won't regret it.<br /><br />BUT. A word of advice? Go for a different model, a cheaper one. This one is really costly and I don't even use the other stuff it comes with. You won't need it.

  579. This is my second Braun epil device. This first one I purchased overseas was a basic Braun Silk-Epil unit (about 10 years ago) without the wet-dry feature, no extra attachments, etc etc. It was just a basic epilator. I remember thinking that the first epil device was so painful that I would rather shave every second day than be in total pain for hours while I slowly ripped out my leg hair. That being said, I decided to use the old device again several months ago. I was surprised that the pain was not as bad as I remembered - or perhaps I am no longer as sensitive to pain - who knows. Nevertheless, I started epilating my legs again with my old Silk-Epil about 3 months ago.<br /><br />When I saw that I could take this one in the shower, I was sold. So, I purchased this unit and have been using it in the shower. This product is great because I only need to use it about once every 3 weeks. The hair comes back weaker and not nearly as thick - it just really is not so noticeable like an unshaved leg would be. Epilating the upper legs is painful, but the lower leg is completely easy and not painful at all. Bikini area - better grab a stick to bite on....it hurts like.... Under arms - same as bikini.<br /><br />I find this product great for the legs, but would not venture to use it on bikini or underarms as the pain is too bad for me.<br /><br />Also, in comparison with the simple basic epilator from Braun - I am just not sure this one is really worth the extra money. I find it difficult to clean out the tweezed hair from the appliance under the shower as the hair is wet and sticks to the pieces of the epilator. I also do not find myself using any of the extra attachments, so a basic unit would have worked just as well.<br /><br />Overall - I TOTALLY suggest epilating to anyone who does not do it already. It is far better than shaving and you will be happy with the results. This is a great item and does the job well. I think it works better dry than wet - best on warm skin right out of shower.

  590. I recently received this epilator to review, by BzzAgent.<br />I've always wanted to try an epilator, but was always afraid to. Now that this little miracle tool has come into my life, I may never shave my legs again! Started with my underarms, just to get one of the most sensitive parts over with first (brave, I know!). That was scary at first, but I quickly realized that the anticipation was worst than the actual pain. Although it missed a few strays here and there, they were very easy to spot thanks to the bright beam of light. I went over them and they were quickly eliminated. Then, I decided to do my lower and upper legs. Lower legs were a snap and did not hurt at all. Upper legs were fine too, just a tiny discomforting on the inner upper thighs. Now, the bikini area... That was a whole other ball game. Front was easy, but definitely not painless, as I have very course hair there. After much flinching and toe curling, I was able to get thru most of it. On the sides, it pinched my skin once and left tiny red marks and that was really painful, but also my fault, as I did not stretch the skin enough. I decided to leave well enough alone and not get too close... I'll leave the more delicate areas to my trusty old razor, for now. All in all, I will continue to use this epilator mainly because it's quick, easy and for the most part tolerable. I can't wait to see how long the results last. I'm a true believer!

  607. This really does work well. I was afraid, like so many other hair removal products it would barely work or not work at all, but it does in fact, remove the hair effectively. I would probably give this 4.5 stars, but that is not an option. Some of my complaints, I do not think can be helped. It does hurt. I expected this though. If plucking hairs with tweezers or waxing hurts, I do not think there is any way for this not to hurt. My first attempt to use it, I almost chickened out. I touched it to a few hairs and was shocked by the sharp pain of it immediately pulling the hairs out. I imagined doing my whole leg would be impossible. I was desperate though. I have terribly thick hair, very sensitive skin and a an unavoidable knack for getting razor burn. So, I took a couple shots of whiskey, put on an episode of star trek and set to work. The first few seconds were not pleasant. I had read that it got better the longer you did it but did not hold much hope for this to be the case. Surprisingly, it did get better. After about a minute, my skin seemed to toughen up a little bit and I got a knack for how to use it. Holding the skin taunt eased the pain a little. It was slow going, and it took several episodes before I had done my entire leg. When I finished though, my skin was smoother than it has been in months. I read that you can shave in between uses to get it closer, but I decided to epilate the hairs as they grew in. My leg has stayed mostly hair free as well as ingrown hair free for several weeks now. I am extremely glad I bought this product. As I said, my main complaint, the pain, could not be helped and is not the fault of the design. The only complaint I have about the actual product is a small one. The 'precision' tool which has a smaller opening so you can epilate on your face is not very precise at all. It is located in the center of the tool and it is extremely difficult to see where the opening is, in relation to the hair. I gave up after a few tries and will probably not use it on my face again. It took me a few days to work up the courage to do my second leg, but when I did, I used the epilator in the shower instead of dry. Again, it hurt, but it hurt less in the shower. I ran my legs under hot water for several minutes so they were a little numb to the sharpness to begin with, and the hot water opened up the pores in my skin a little more. I have used it in the shower since then. (Also, it could have hurt esp for me as I do have a lot of thick hair and may not be so bad if you have finer hair.)<br /><br />Summery: It hurts but mostly at first and does get better. It is slow and time consuming the first time, but maintenance is much quicker and hurts a lot less. The product is well designed and does what it claims to do. I would recommend it to anyone who was looking for an alternate way to remove hair.<br /><br />Tips to make it hurt less: Pull the skin taunt. Do not push down on skin, let the epilator just glide over the skin. Hot water helps. Find something to distract yourself like a good movie. And, if you are so inclined some bourbon or wine or whatever your tastes prefer.ill probably not use it on my face again. I was hoping that this one would be less painful since it had a lot of improvements and it is waterproof. Unfortunately, even in the water I am too much of a wuss to use this on my legs. It hurts and it leads to bright red tiny holes all over my leg where the hair was just yanked out.<br /><br />Luckily, it works great on my face. I have a few dark (and lots of light) hairs on my chin. The pivoting head is nice and allows the machine to curve along my face and get all of the hairs. I use this on high speed with absolutely no pain to stay smooth. It works great! I did learn one lesson the hard way though; make sure your skin is clean before you use this epilator. I was tired one night and used toner on my face and then I felt a hair and decided to epilate without washing the toner off. My epilator has been oily since then. I have been soaking it in rubbing alcohol and it is finally almost back to normal. Make sure your skin is clean before using!<br /><br />I personally don't care for the shaver head because it doesn't get a close enough shave for me. I have not tried the trimmer cap because I can only think of one area where that would be beneficial and I am not that brave. I mostly just leave on the efficiency cap and use that one.<br /><br />This epilator does have a great battery life. I have used it quite a bit and only had to charge it once. The charge seems to last for several hours.<br /><br />Overall this is a great epilator if you can handle the pain. I am definitely too sensitive to use it all over. I like using it on my face, but I would not have paid the current price for it for just that.

  640. First, the issue of pain ... this is only mildly discomfortable, largely because it doesn't actually work. After all, breaking hairs off rather than pulling them doesn't hurt.<br /><br />I purchased it in May, hoping to have a razor-free and wax-free summer. Given that hair grows in cycles, I used it every two to three days for several weeks at a time, hoping that it would eventually lead to freedom from the razor. It never happened. It always, ALWAYS left stubble behind. A few weeks ago, I pulled it back out hoping maybe I'd done something wrong and it would help get ready for spring break. Nope. But, I think I figured out why. It's not actually pulling hairs ... it's simply breaking them off. OK ... maybe it's pulling some of them, but having just spent a whole hour on the fourth session in 10 days, my lower legs still have significant stubble. I'm not overly furry ... . I certainly feel a few twinges, but nothing to make me wince. I seriously don't think it's pulling more than 25% of the hairs.<br /><br />I've tried every which way ... in the shower, in the bath, after the shower (clean, dry skin). Nothing improves the results.
  641. I always do my research when choosing a semi-expensive product. I spent a few hours reading reviews on Amazon as well as other review sites and for what I wanted (epilating multiple areas), this one sounded perfect.<br /><br />Now, if you are very sensitive to pain then I am giving you fair warning: this HURTS! The first time I tried it I thought I would never use it again...if you have ever gotten a tattoo, this is pretty close but it feels a little worse because you are doing it to yourself. But I do have some good news...it does get better. I waited to write my review until about a month after I started epilating. I just finished the third time and it is so much better than the first! And it is totally worth it. My hair grows so quickly that I used to have to shave every single day so this is great...I would say it lasts about two weeks, but one thing I noticed is that my hair grows at different speeds so I have had to do some touch up here and there. The touch ups don't hurt at all, probably because the hair is so random.<br /><br />Anyway, as far as other areas are concerned, I haven't gotten there yet. I'm not ready to go through that initial pain again just yet. But I will get there. One tip is to get a post-epilation/waxing lotion or roll-on to apply immediately after you epilate. It makes a world of difference for pain as well as red marks.

It seems to remove hair faster and cause less discomfort.<br /><br />Both models leave the skin feeling smooth.<br /><br />A frank discussion about an unmentioned hair problem:<br />The hair on women's forearms is seldom mentioned. Talking about overarm hair is a last taboo. Unlike underarm hair, which is okay to discuss, the problem many of us women have with hair on our arms is to be ignored. We can't wear long sleeves all the time though. The Silk Epil epilator is for removing hair from \\"legs, body, and face.\\" Continuing to be honest, it works well to remove forearm hair.

  662. After many years of trying various hair removal methods, I finally found one I like. I'm very surprised and want all my friends and family to try it!<br />I may just be lucky, but I had NO pain removing hair from my legs or arms, just a tugging sensation. This could have to do with age and many years of shaving. Also, the first time I tried it, I took ibuprophen an hour beforehand. But now I don't bother.<br /><br />Afterwards I wondered if the hair on my legs was merely broken off, because I didn't even feel the tugging most of the time, and my legs didn't feel completely smooth, they were left with little stubby-feeling bumps.<br />[*UPDATE* 1-19-14: Legs are getting smoother, bumps are going away, they appear to be hairs that were just too short to remove, from shaving. They are taking a long time to grow back, but I have read that hairs grow in cycles and not all at the same time. I expect after a few months the legs will be completely smooth.]<br />[UPDATE 2-27-14: Legs are now smooth, very little stubble can be felt. It takes awhile for all the hairs to grow out long enough to be grabbed.]<br /><br />I also epilated my forearms. There was no pain and they are smooth, though the skin has been very dry, requiring lots of moisturizer.<br /><br />Then I worked up courage and tried an arm pit. There I had a problem. Skin was caught in the epilator and I got a nasty blood blister. I have decided to just continue shaving underarms. This is more of a problem for older people whose skin may not be as tight there anymore. It's impossible to pull the skin tight as your other arm is occupied.<br /><br />Now, the face...<br />This situation was similar to the cold waxing I've been doing for years, painful with white pimples and irritation after. The epilator pain is similar to an electric shock. I've found the best way to deal with this is to first shave the skin with the included trimmer head, making the hair very short (but still able to be grabbed). Thenhold the skin very taught, with the other hand and various grimaces, holding the tongue underneath to stretch it, etc. I use the protector cap made for the face, so only a small area is done at a time, on the highest speed, and tap-tap-tap then take a break. A little while later tap again. Hold the epilator perpendicular to the skin.<br />It has taken me a couple of weeks to get all the hair off the upper lip, with tolerable pain. But now it's easier up-keep, as they only grow in a few at a time.<br />[UPDATE ON FACE 2-27-14]: Irritation pimples don't appear as often now, and the massaging head is excellent for the upper lip. Just be careful to keep the skin tight. The buzzing provided distracts the skin from the pain and it hurts much less. In my opinion, this Silk Epil 7 is worth the cost over other models just to have this massaging head. (But the package with 5 extra caps may not be. They only cover up tweezers to create a smaller area, so if you're an experienced user you may save some money and get the version without the extra caps.)<br />Braun should make a smaller massaging head specifically for the upper lip.<br /><br />The Olay wipes that came with the unit caused me to break out, I can't use them.<br /><br />This model, the SE7681 with the extra attachments, was a great choice due to the speeds, the power-speed dial (can't accidentally turn on or off), the wet-dry capability and the fact that it's cordless!<br /><br />I was disappointed to see they've now come out with an updated model (SE7921spa) that includes an exfoliator brush...wish it would fit this one. But reviews on that improvement are not good so far, so it's not worth buying the newer model just yet. I'll be using my back brush and exfoliation gloves, instead.<br />I highly recommend people try this, you might surprise yourself and be freed from daily shaving, cuts, or sticky wax removal methods.
  663. The Braun Se7681 Silk-Epil Wet and Dry Epilator works very well.<br /><br />My mother has been having trouble with chin hairs since her menopause. I was able to take them off in seconds with this. Since then, we have done it several times with quick success. It charges fast and holds the charge for a long time.<br /><br />The different attachments are :<br />High Frequency Massage System Cap<br />Efficiency Pro Cap<br />Underarm Cap<br />Precision Cap<br />Shaver Head with OptiTrim comb<br /><br />We laughed about the names of some of these: High Frequency Massage System, Efficiency Pro Cap, OptiTrim comb!<br />Basically there is one cap that is for sensitive areas like your underarms, one that is the shaving head with a trimmer, one cap for using on facial hairs, one that gets rid of hairs quick, that is the Efficiency Pro cap, and one that supposedly massages while working.<br /><br />The directions aren't the easiest to understand and are pretty brief. It isn't hard to figure out though and the caps go on and off easily.<br /><br />The epilator itself is easy to hold, although the dial is a little bit strange to use. Once you get used to it, it is fine. There is a LED light on it to make it easier to see. The dial adjusts speeds and the fast one is quite speedy.<br /><br />This is where the epilator shines: It does a great job of getting rid of hairs fast. My mother doesn't feel any pain or very little pain and the hairs were pretty well established with roots. The hairs have come back less and less, so I feel the epilator is doing its job of getting the hairs down at the roots.<br /><br />The cord is easy to plug in and start charging instantly. The Oil of Olay wipes were Ok but not something we would buy after they are gone, since lotion works just as well.<br /><br />All in all, this is a great epilator and the silver color looks good with the white. It can be used wet or dry and that makes it even better. Thumbs up on this one!
  664. I confess that I've never used an electric epilator until now. I've tried the OTC products for waxing, (disaster!), and wet shaved for over 40 years. The electric shavers never lasted long enough and just didn't give me the smooth results I wanted. I've researched the different epilators and brands but never committed to purchasing one, so I jumped at the chance to own this many-featured, top of the line, Braun model.<br /><br />When it arrived I plugged it in to charge and read the instructions thoroughly. As described on the product page, it comes with many heads for epilating the different areas of your body. The included charger works quickly and the unit has maintained the charge throughout any of the times I've used it (hours). For storage, all pieces fit neatly into a white drawstring bag. When charged, I chose the massaging head to begin with on my legs.<br /><br />There are two speeds on a circular selector on the front of the device. You press in and rotate to choose 1 or 2, for either gentle or efficient epilation, and it is quite easy to operate. I have to mention here, that a wonderful feature of this unit is the \\"Smartlight\\", a localized light on the body of the unit so that you can actually see the area you are working on! Ingenious! It REALLY helps! Ok, that noted, I choose the first speed to begin my adventure. I'd shaved my legs a couple days prior so the hair was the correct length for epilating, and I began.<br /><br />I was surprised. It wasn't too horrible! Actually, it didn't hurt as much as I'd expected, and I do believe the massaging head helps, as I've also tried the regular head. It's also important to remember to epilate at a right angle to the skin, and not to press into it, but only to glide over the skin. Exfoliating before hand and making sure that the skin is clean and dry are helpful hints, in my mind. Also, keeping the skin tight is also extremely helpful in areas with fragile and sensitive skin (think, bikini area and armpits especially). I've not used it wet yet so I can't address that but I have used it on moist skin and I feel that dry skin seems the easiest and least painful of the two. The \\"wet use\\" feature is certainly great as you can just rinse it off to clean it without worrying about damaging it.<br /><br />After finishing my legs, I moved on to the \\"nether\\" regions. Yeowee!!! Ok, I expected it to be sensitive. I gritted my teeth and continued. I managed to do a fair job and was pleased with the smooth results. The cooling cloths helped calm and sooth the area, though a cool washcloth did about the same thing.<br /><br />Through following uses, I've found that there is a narrow window for the ideal hair length and it is directly proportional to the pain experienced when epilating. Long hair hurts more, but that is not a fault of this device. I think that it would be true with any similar epilator. What may be best for waxing, is not best for epilating.<br /><br />This is as far as I've ventured with the unit. I've not used it on my face or armpits. Shaving and tweezing are too easy for me in these areas and I'm not really comfortable yet with my skills to feel certain I wouldn't take my entire eyebrow off if I tried it there, even if using the included head for these tasks. Fortunately for me, I do not need it on my upper lip or elsewhere on my face.<br /><br />Also worth mentioning, this unit includes an entirely separate shaving head. So, you can wet or dry shave the areas you don't want to epilate, so convenient, and saves extra expense and shelf space!<br /><br />To summarize, I am very happy with this epilator. It does a good job and, thankfully, it does get easier and less painful with repeated use. If I were to pick one to purchase, I would be very happy with the performance and cost of the Braun Silk-Epil 7681 Wet and Dry Epilator.

  669. I purchased this epilator after having used emoji for about three years. First time I tried it was in the shower. For me, I think my hairs were too weak to be fully pulled out while wet and many of them seemed to snap off instead of be pulled from the root. For beginners, using it in the shower with the efficiency head is a great option because it does really help with the pain. Epilation can be very painful when you first begin. It improves greatly over time as your hairs grow in thinner and lighter and you get used to the process. That said, I had the smoothest results using it dry without any cap at all. I use it with all the tweezers fully exposed - this is not recommended for beginners as it will be very painful. But once you adjust, this method does catch the smallest of hairs. When I used the standard cap or efficiency cap I didn't get the same smooth results. Although I don't use the wet feature while I epilate I do use it to clean and sanitize the epilator head after each use. This is a very helpful feature that I think also keeps it performing at it's best.<br /><br />Unfortunately, the battery is now dying after about 8 months of use (I use it every two to three weeks). The red battery low light will flash within 2 minutes of use and the motor runs slow. after about ten minutes it will shut off altogether. I need to see if it's under warranty and if I can send in for repairs. Otherwise I have really found it to be helpful. It's pricey and should last at least two years in my opinion.

I always seem to miss a few hairs somehow and still need to shave, but that time is cut into nothing. Like it and I would recommend it for winter mostly but not so much when you want bare legs.<br />The reason it gets 3 stars instead of 5 is that some hairs are hard to get so it takes awhile. I need to use it twice a week and it takes lots longer than a razor. I was hoping I'd only need to do legs every 3 weeks. It comes with a razor attachment that works pretty good and I need to use if I do want a close shave. Heads are easy to change. I like it enough that I'll keep using it but wish shave lasted longer and was closer.<br />One good thing is that after I did get used to it, I found it easy to use out of water as well.<br />Have never used attachments other than shaver.<br />I have blonde, thin hair.   684. One word....OUCH. This is a painful product. I really love the concept but can't deal with the pain (and I had natural childbirth that wasn't so bad).   685. This epilator works really well, so be warned that the first time you use it it hurts like ... heck! I had already been using other epilators for several years, so for me it doesn't hurt that much now. Some of the areas that I use it on, like my calves, the hair almost never grows back. I've tried 2 Panasonics and also an older Braun that is not a wet / dry model and I think this one is the best yet. Since it is wet and dry and cordless I sometimes use it in the shower with a little hair conditioner so that it moves smoothly on my skin. The battery life is good and sometimes I don't finish all areas that I wanted to epilate, but it does recharge in about an hour.
  686. This is the first epilator I've ever purchased. When the coiled spring epilator came out many years ago, my mother purchased one. When I tried it, I swore I'd never do it again because it was so painful. With that, I was a bit skeptical of buying this one. However, I absolutely love this product now! I use it quite often on my legs and have done away with shaving. I read that some people felt it was painful but I find the pain to be rather minimal. I use the towelettes that came with it and I think that helps with making the experience a bit better. Because it is a wet and dry device I did try it in the shower. I personally won't be doing that again because it was rather uncomfortable and no where near as painless as doing it dry. Also, the battery seems to hold a pretty decent charge. I'm able to do both my legs with no issues at all. I have not used this on any sensitive areas but I did try it on my arms. The only issue I ran in to was that it left red marks or irritation marks if you will. They did go away though after about a day. Either way this is a great product, worth each and every penny, and I love it! I only wish I had found it sooner.

Unfortunately due to extended use in water it no longer held a charge for more than a couple minutes. At first I was upset however in the manual it is clearly stated that consistent use in water will affect battery life and charge time, so I decided to buy another Braun because I was impressed with my first epilator in terms of hair removal. This time I decided to purchase the Rolls Royce of Braun epilators and bought the 7 series that came with multiple attachments that included a shaver head as well. I must say I am not disappointed and am so happy I bought another Braun! I honestly have no idea how other reviewers can complain about this little wonder. Yes it hurts like hell but beauty is pain people!!! I love that it comes with all the different sized attachment heads and the shaver head is awesome for when the epilator head might miss a few fine hairs. I also like that it comes with a shaver head because epilating can take a little time and if I am in a rush I can snap on the shaver head and be hair free in less time and then epilate later when the hair grows back. For those of you that it is your first time epilating just follow the directions, limit the use with water, and you'll be a silk wonder! Also this is a steal on amazon at the $100 price point because I bought my first one at Target for $100 and it only had 2 attachments, this little baby has it all for the same price, way to go amazon!!!!

  709. When I first received this item I had no idea what an epilator was - I just thought I was getting an elector shaver that could be used wet or dry and had several different heads that could be changed out depending on what kind of hair removal job you were doing.<br /><br />After a brief scan through the directions I learned that an epilator actually pulls the hairs out from the roots via dozens of tiny tweezer-like things. First off, do not do what I did and try the epilator head without using the wipes. It hurts. Not a lot, but enough that I was like, \\"Oh god, why???\\"<br /><br />The wipes that are included help a lot. You also want to let the hair get to a certain length before using the epilator. The directions say that too long doesn't work and although it can pluck out even the tiniest hairs it works best if it is a little bit long. Also, if you haven't used an epilator before, I'd use it on a relatively tough part of your body that won't show at first (I tried my thigh above the knee). This way you can kind of get a good gauge for whether or not your skin will tolerate the epilator because it can cause a rash to break out. You wouldn't want to start on your underarms or face or anything that is really sensitive or would cause you to go into hiding if you had a bad reaction.<br /><br />If it all works out, Great! You'll be hair free for awhile since you've gotten it at the root. If it doesn't, you still have a regular shaver that can be used either wet or dry with a variety of function heads. Enjoy!

  719. I just received my Braun Silk-epil 7 in the mail toady. I was so excited to tried as soon as I got as I have been making my research for a long time to find the best epilator for such amount of money. Let me explain how was my experience with this Braun series 7.<br />what was in the box?<br />It came with 5 attachments including a shaver head, a trimmer cap, an efficiency cap, a sensitive area cap, and a facial cap. Also, it came with the charger, Olay wipes, small cleaning brush and travel bag.<br />How was the pain from 1 to 10( 10 is the worst)?<br />I used it on my legs, my arms and my underarms. The pain on my legs was 5 out of 10. I used it dry and I used the wipes that came with it just 30sec before epilating as the instruction said. the pain was not that bad, it hurts but not that much that make you scream or gets your eyes watery. on my arms the pain was 6 out of 10 why does it hurt more? Because the nature of the hair, the length of the hair and the skin. My hair on my arms was much thinner, a little bit longer so I felt it pinches more. Also, the skin on my arms is more sensitive so I got red dots and little pumps almost allover my arms.<br />On my underarms, Here I used it dry once and wet the other time. for the dry use, oh my god it is 9 of 10. My biggest mistake was to use it dry on my underarms. I can not tell you how much irritation I had, I could not put my arm down. Even tried to put the first aid pain relief that you use for cuts and burns but I could not stand it, I had to wash it very quickly and put a cloth with cold water on it. it really helped a lot. However when I used it wet for the other underarm, it was almost painless and get the hair very quick. I was done in a minute, irritation free. I think the irritation happened because my skin was dry and going back and forth for such sensitive area was too much.<br />what was the result comparing to shaving and waxing?<br />I used to wax for a long time and I was doing it myself, but after I got my son I became really busy so I started to shave. Using this epilator gave me the same smooth skin that I miss from waxing, in a short time which what I was getting from shaving.<br />what I love about it?<br />How easy to hold.<br />Easy to clean.<br />The bright light.<br />Fully charged in just one hour.<br />Wet and dry use.<br />Multiple attachments.<br />2 speeds.<br />Giving smooth skin<br />Getting the hair out from the root, so it will take longer to grow back.<br />Remember:<br />Not to use it dry for underarms<br />Not to use any kind of deodorant or perfumes on your irritated skin.<br />Not to charge it near the water, it will not work anyway while it is charging.<br />Overall I am very satisfied with the results and I would recommended for anyone looking for an epilator. I will add more update as soon as I use it on different areas. Update: I just want to mention that the hair took a long time to grow back, defiantly much thiner.ot my son I became really busy so I started to shave. Using this epilator gave me the same smooth skin that I miss from waxing, in a short time which what I was getting from shaving.<br />what I love about it?<br />How easy to hold.<br />Easy to clean.<br />The bright light.<br />Fully charged in just one hour.<br />Wet and dry use.<br />Multiple attachments.<br />2 speeds.<br />Giving smooth skin<br />Getting the hair out from the root, so it will take longer to grow back.<br />Remember:<br />Not to use it dry for underarms<br />Not to use any kind of deodorant or perfumes on your irritated skin.<br />Not to charge it near the water, it will not work anyway while it is charging.<br />Overall I am very satisfied with the results and I would recommended for anyone looking for an epilator.   736. Note: This is my first time using an epilator, so I can't compare it to other brands. I have also only used it on wet skin on my legs and armpits.<br /><br />Using the epilator for the first time hurt a lot more than I expected. I knew that having a bunch of hairs quickly plucked out of your skin wasn't going to be fun, but I was really shocked by how sharp the pain was. After the first time I used it, my legs were kind of red and scratchy and my armpits were sore! However, after my third use, the pain became MUCH more bearable. I am also really pleased with the results in comparison to shaving, especially on the armpits. I'm not left with gross armpit stubble, and the new hairs grow out much thinner, which makes epilating the next time less painful.<br /><br />My only complaint is that it doesn't do a very clean job. Again, I'm not sure if other brands might be better with this since this is my first epilator, but I find that even after going over the same patch of skin multiple times, the epilator still doesn't catch a couple of hairs. I usually use a razor right afterward to ensure I don't have any stragglers. I've also found that the epilator sometimes just breaks the hair instead of pulling it from the root.<br /><br />This epilator is also great because it comes it a variety of heads (some have massaging grooves, others limit the surface area of the epilator for more sensitive areas, and there is even one with a razor head!). I usually use the massaging head, but there are some that look great for the upper lip and bikini line.

  747. I used a Philips epilator for over 10 years, yes the same one and still works, but I thought the technology should got better after 10 years, so I decided to shop for a new one. Is very faast, a lot less painful than my ancient Philips, I was able to use it on my armpits that was something I couldn't manage to do with my Philips, I'm not saying is not painful it is very painful on your armpits at least for me, but I was able to tolerate it. Since I was able to tolerate it in such a sensitive area then I proceeded to use it on bikini areas where it was super painful with my old epilator, and I was able to do a way better job than before, so I used it for legs, armpits and bikini area and it was still running, so battery life doesn't seem to be an issue.<br /><br />The trimmer is very good, it doesn't pinch your skin at all, I used it without the comb and I was a little scared at the beginning, but soon I noticed it was perfectly safe.<br />About the caps I only ended up using the main, I tried to use the smaller cap for the armpits cause thought it would be more gentle, but it was the opposite, the main cap massages and that helps mask the pain and it has thingies that helps pic up the hairs, so I found the other caps useless.<br /><br />Well I think that's enough review for a one time use, I will update after a few more uses

  755. Reading the reviews I was psyched up for torture and pain... but &#34;if it don't hurt, you ain't pretty&#34; someone once told me- I was complaining about sore feet in heels. Using this for over a month, I really like it... and do not think it hurts as much as I was led to believe by other reviewers. My body hair is greatly diminished... saving me time compared to shaving almost everyday. I do a little maintenance shaving between weekly use to get missed hairs and fuzz - but this is minimal. I also exfoliate and moisturize deeply after use as recommended. I really like the design and bright little light beaming on the work area. The battery is good too, I can do all areas of my body I use it on in one charge. The 1st couple times there was more hair and I was more timid so I did it over 2 charges. I use it on my entire leg, arms, armpits and abdomen with great success. I also have used it to remove random light fuzz on buttocks, small of my low back etc... without need for regular use there. I have used it on my bikini area.. but got bumps...that with an increased sensitivity using this device in and around my private parts... I am shaving 'down there' again for now. But the bulk of my body's acreage is nicely maintained by this device. I am caucasian, blue eyed, blonde with northern european genetics and fine hair... meaning the diameter of my body hair is 1000th of an inch in diameter... compared with most people having 2-3 times thicker hair shafts.... so this device does it's job on my style of body hair.

  759. The epilator works exactly as it was described to work. I have tried multiple methods for hair removal (shaving, creams, waxing, laser) and this one is definitely the most efficient for the cost. It does sting a little on areas that I have never had waxed or lasered, but even by the second time I used it, the pain had already lessened. The hair grows back minimally and stays away longer than if it were to have been waxed off. It is perfect for people with excessive body hair but not enough time to constantly take care of it. After one thorough use of the epilator, I have only had to do &#34;touch-ups&#34; occasionally instead of daily attention. I would (and have already been!) definitely recommend this product to anyone who is trying to get rid of unwanted hair. If you can handle a little pain to get there, the results are certainly worth it. :)

This means another round of epilation. The red bumps that show up also mean that my legs aren't ready to go 'on show' for at least a day or 2 after using this, but by then more hairs are starting to grow in! The effects definitely didn't last as long as I had expected, and for the extra time (not to mention pain) involved I personally don't think this item is worth it over shaving. While ingrown hairs could be greatly reduced by exfoliating, that didn't entirely solve the problem either, leaving further unsightly marks on my legs.<br /><br />I will continue to use it every now and then, such as several before going on vacation when I'd like to reduce the burden of shaving slightly, but unfortunately I don't think this will ever replace having to shave.

I've only had the courage to do this on my lower legs so far and they are lovely and smooth. I'm always careful to exfoliate before and after to prevent ingrowns and it seems to have worked so far. Going to try upper legs soon :D So far I'm happy with this purchase and would recommend it. I finally decided to pay a bit more and go with Braun, because my old one was Braun, and it lasted for so many years before I have to replace it, so I trust the quality. Also, it seems that Panasonic and Emjoi all have problem of not being powerful and slow from the reviews I read. If the epilator is not fast enough, it's not just the matter that it's harder to remove the hair, it's the matter of you are going to get hurt more.<br /><br />I am glad that I got this one. It's better than my old Braun. It's fast, doesn't hurt at all! The massage system really does its job.   771. This is my first time using an epilator, and I would say it has been performing up to my expectations. I was reading the reviews about how painful this is going to be, but so far it has been bearable. I used to wax my legs in the past, maybe that is why the pain was bearable. Advisable to epilator right after a hot shower when the pores are still open! I tried once straight after shower and once randomly in the middle of the day, and I would say that there really is a difference in the pain level.<br /><br />I also tried epilating my underarms. I used a tweezer and plucked it the first time round, and then waited for the hairs to grow out again then I used the epilator. I have read about people who used the epilator on their underarms straight the first time and had their skin stuck in the epilator or some had bleeding after they epilated. I was really glad that I didnt have any of those problems. Actually epilating the underarms felt less painful than epilating my legs. I guess the act of tweezing manually the first time round makes the skin more used to tweezing and it plucks out the roots so the new hairs that grew out had a 'weaker' root? Which explains why I didnt have much problems epilating my underarms. So it is advisable to pluck it manually the first time round then start depilating!<br /><br />The only down side to it is that although we are able to remove the parts to wash it separately, but i still find it hard to wash off all the hairs which are stuck on the tweezers, and the roller parts at the side, even with the help of the small brush supplied. :/<br /><br />But overall, it is a great buy! :D
  772. FANTASTIC!! I bought a less expensive epilator/shaver through Amazon. It broke with first use. (Amazon graciously accepted return.)   783. Let me start by saying...it hurts. It pulls hair out from the root so ...it should hurt. With that said, it only hurts for a short period of time, less than a min, then my brain starts to get used to the pain and I am fine. I found it helps to take a washcloth or something and 'rough up the skin' before starting which basically desensitizes the skin. I found it really helps a lot, then after the first pass or two I don't even notice any pain. The wipes do work a bit, also ice packs will help numb it up. Afterwards I use some cortisone anti-itch which really helps with the red bumps. I get red bumps for about 4 hrs after epilating if I don't use cortisone.<br /><br />It pulls out even the smallest hairs. Even hairs that are 1/16 above the surface get plucked. Hair does grow back much finer and after a few months I get 'patchy' hair re-growth. It works well in the shower/bath (waterproof) but I prefer to use it dry. It pulls out even very small fine hairs. I used it on my upper lip a few times and it does just fine. It comes with a separate head for that, which is basically just a cover over the normal head, but it works well.<br /><br />After epilating the first few times my legs were not smooth, they were a little rough for some reason. I am not sure why but it happened again recently. I used the epilator for many months, then shaved for 3 weeks, then went back to the epilator and when I went back it took about a week or two epilator times before my legs were smooth. Odd, but be sure to give it at least 3 times of using it before you get discouraged.<br /><br />It also comes with a head for a traditional electric razor and it has a guard so it can be used as a trimmer, so if a man wanted to trim a beard or something; the guard would work for that, but it could also be used as a regular electric razor if a man or woman wanted to shave.

It has multiple speeds, and includes a head cover that lets you focus on small areas.<br /><br />The shaver does not shave a close as a straight razor, but it is pretty good. Over time, more and more areas will become epilated and so you will be having less and less hair to remove each time.

  801. I only recently found about about epilation and after an extensive online search decided to give the Silk-epil 7 a try, given its many, MANY positive ratings. I really wanted to love this epilator, but a series of events has left me utterly dissatisfied.<br /><br />Firstly, I opened the box only to find out the Efficiency Cap had not included, I had been given two Underarm Caps instead. When I phoned Braun Customer Service, requesting that they send me the cap I was missing, I was given the run-around for 30 minutes, them insisting it wasn't included in my model, which it IS included in 7681. Instead of apologizing for their error, I was spoken to like a child and told that I could PURCHASE the cap but that they themselves did not sell the replacement parts. Worst. Customer. Service. Ever. If you expect them to do anything, don't waste your time.<br /><br />On to the device itself. I really do like the look of it, but it does not perform as well as everyone says. At least not for me. I have used it every two to three days for a week and a half now and I STILL have hairs left, and stubble. I know my hair grows quickly, I was at the point of having to shave EVERY DAY, which is why I decided to try epilating, but if the hair is actually pulled from the root as it claims, it should take more than 2 days to grow back and give stubble. Every time I epilate there are still long hairs it doesn't pull, regardless of how many times or in how many directions I go over the area.<br /><br />As for the pain, it really is bearable. The first time I tried it I almost cried, and I literally could only handle a VERY small area at a time. But by the third, fourth, fifth tries, I hardly felt anything anymore (a sign it isn't pulling hairs maybe?) and I can do both lower legs without wincing. My legs don't get red afterwards anymore either. I haven't tried much on my upper legs yet as I'm trying to see if the thing actually works, which as I have said, I'm not impressed. My legs aren'tsmooth like with shaving. It constantly feels like I have stubble. Ugh... frustrating. I'll keep going for a few more weeks though, before I toss it and try another make. And thanks to Braun Customer Service I shall NEVER be buying from them again.<br /><br />As other reviewers have said, unless you plan on using it for your underarms and face, this model really isn't work the extra money. Maybe if I had purchased the 7181 model it would have actually come with the caps it should have.

  815. I have been using one of the old model of Braun epilator for a very long time (almost 12 years). It is still running good. But I wanted to get an upgraded model as the old one is not as fast. After buying the Braun SE7681 Silk-épil 7 Wet and Dry Epilator I have been using it for legs, hands, underarms, bikini and upper lips & face. Its amazing how quickly I can get epilating done. I take lesser time to epilate than it would take for waxing. Its very easy and comfortable. It also better when used in shower (it hurts a little less). Initially cleaning was a pain, but then I started running the epilator heads under the water and it cleans a little quicker. I hope Braun comes up with a better design to clean the heads. The only other downside is that after fully charged you can use it for about 40 mins until it runs out of charge - but then so far I have never run out of charge without fully epilating. I find that 40 mins is enough to do my full legs and bikini (considering I haven't epilated/shaved for a long time). Update (July 2015): the epilator head stopped working. The motor is fine but the head stopped rotating. There was no damage on the product. I think the gears inside maybe worn out. This is less than 2 years of use. Braun- why is your product not as good as before?? Update(Jan 2016): I had purchased insurance on this product so I got a refund and I purchased a new one (same model). I still continue using this regularly and love it. Its more expensive than what I paid for 2-3 years ago but worth it.

  819. There was a lot of debate in our household about this product before I decided to bite the bullet and buy it for my wife.<br /><br />After three months now, she would not be without this epilator and thinks it’s a brilliant product, but she was so very nervous (to put it mildly) before first use.<br /><br />For her first use she did the following and this helped massively:<br />-Shaved her legs a week before she wanted to epilate: for my wife this mean her hairs were the perfect length the following week, not too long and not too short for the epilator to grab!<br />-Watched the Braun video on how to epilate: this told her what angle to hold it at as well as the kind of speed she should move the epilator at<br />-Epilated whilst in the bath: the warm water not only allowed for easier hair removal but soothed her legs a little after<br />-Used shave gel: the Braun website recommended this, and it made the whole process smoother and more comfortable<br />-Moisturised her legs afterwards: this helped with the soothing process afterwards<br />-Had ibuprofen to hand if the pain was going to be too much… but it wasn’t thankfully<br /><br />My wife was especially nervous as she has never even had a leg wax before, which a friend had suggested would help. Ignoring this advice though she was fine taking all the above steps into account.<br /><br />She did experience some very mild stinging, which was helped by moisturising afterwards, and the day after epilating her legs were so smooth, she was over the moon and decided the mild discomfort was definitely worth it.<br /><br />The first epilation was the most difficult and since then she has epilated her legs weekly and after only two weeks she felt confident enough to epilate her legs dry.<br /><br />The discomfort she feels now is ‘barely noticeable’, and again she makes sure she moisturises her legs afterwards.<br /><br />Epilating is so much easier than shaving and my wife has noticed the small hairs that grow back do appear much finer, they seem to be weakening. She has yet to experience any ingrowing hairs or indeed any drawbacks to epilating.<br /><br />Apparently as she epilates more she will need to do it less frequently but each week there is the odd, very small hair and she wants rid.<br /><br />Highly recommendedck do appear much finer, they seem to be weakening. I hated them, and theyve been like that since I started shaving them, which was many many years ago! lol. I remember hating having to raise my hand in class because I didnt want anyone to see them! It was embarrassing. Well, GOODBYE dark armpits! I've only used this epilator for about a month & there is a noticeable difference! I also used it on my arms, legs, and face.   823. When I received this product, I was very excited to try it. When I opened the box, I got even more excited when I realized that it has a built-in light and the speed setting(two speed setting) is very easy to control. I like how It clicks to the next speed, instead of those slide buttons. It has 5 attachment heads, a bag and a brush that is in perfect size to clean the attachment heads. The attachment heads are supposed to help prevent broken skin and make the epilating experience less painful and intimidating. Each attachment head is for certain parts of the body; so before using this epilator, be sure to read the manual carefully.This epilator is rechargeable which is great if your going away for the weekend and you want to pack light! Now, I have already tried it to remove facial hair, leg hair and armpit hair, and let me tell you, this is the best epilator I have ever used! When I used it on my face, it definitely got rid of my mustache! (not that, it was a lot, but I get very conscious about it. And the hair wasn't even long, I can barely see it!) it left the top of my upper lip red but not irritated for only a few minutes. (I was actually worried that it was gonna stay red until the next day because I have very sensitive skin). The next day, I used it on my leg using the attachment that is specifically for the epilating the legs. I had to go really slow and against the hair growth because my leg hair isn't really that long. (leg hair and armpit hair needs to be at least, half a centimeter to achieve best results.) it didn't really hurt, the attachment head makes it less intimidating to use the epilator. Then I tried it on my armpit, and Lo and behold! No broken skin! No bleeding, no skin irritation, not even any sign of redness! I was very impressed! I gave it a four star because the manual, in my own opinion isn't very user friendly. The drawings for the attachment heads are a little confusing. I also had to read the manual every time I had to change the attachment head, which to me is a little annoying, but it was worth it! Overall, this is a great epilator! Probably, one of the best in the market! It's great for someone who will be using an epilator for the first time!

  834. Let me start this off my saying if you want an epilator, this is a fantastic product. It comes with all the attachments you would need for any body area and a bag to hold them. I love that it is wet or dry and can be fully submersed in water (this is a necessity for me). It has 2 settings...I really only use the higher setting because I am impatient and have to go too slow across my skin with the lower setting. It charges quickly and the battery lasts quite a while even when using it under water. I would recommend this product to anyone who is looking at epilators.<br /><br />If you have never used an epilator, I have a few thoughts on them in general. This is my first time ever using an epilator and I had no idea what I was in for. I have always had a very big issue with razor burn and my skin is extremely sensitive and dry (I have eczema). Because of how bad my razor burn is, I was having to always buy bathing suits with shorts and often wouldn't even wear shorts if my legs were acting up. I also would get extremely painful razor burn on my underarms and I wouldn't wear sleeveless shirts because of it. I tried shaving, waxing, hair removal cream, everything. I read many reviews about Epilators being painful to start but the results being worth it because the hairs come back finer and sparse...that is very true, especially the PAIN part! I have a very high pain tolerance and I struggled to get this going but I was determined knowing that this was my last hope for hair removal without damaging my skin. It makes a huge difference with the pain to use it underwater (I tried both dry and wet). I highly recommend using it in the bath tub. It hurts REALLY bad the first 2-3 times because you are pulling thick hairs out (from years of shaving) and a lot of them. If you use it weekly for the first month, it because less painful each time. I have been using mine for a couple months now and it is tolerable. It still hurts, but I don't spend an hour and a half doing my legs having to give myself pep talks every 30 seconds. The results from using this for 2 months is amazing. The hair grows back thinner and very sporadically located, so you are not having to pull as many hairs out when you use it. I am to the point that I use it once every 1-2 weeks and I am not self conscious about my legs in between because you can hardly see or feel the hair that is there. I get red dots that last less than 24 hours afterward but other than that...NO RAZOR BURN. It is AMAZING!!! I am so happy that I finally found something I can use. I still have not built up the strength to use it in my underarms because the pain is too much...I am building up to that in the next couple months. I recently was able to use it in my bikini area but that took a lot of pep-talks. My suggestion...go with the hair and take tiny sections at a time before moving to the next inch. Ultimately, if you can tolerate pain, epilators are amazing. But it is not for everyone.

However, I could only use it for less than six months before having to send it for repair, as the battery would no longer charge. Got it back with epilator head replaced, it seemed fine. Another couple of months later, the battery is dead again and no longer charges. On top of that, the charger comes with a plug that will not fit anywhere, the two round pins that look European are too big for the sockets they have there or in South America, where the standard is the same. You will need an adaptor anyway. So it was a total disappointment, waste of money and BRAUN does not even reply to messages of complaint. Lame customer service. I had to rate it one star because of its design, that is all.[[ASIN:B0077PLNNE Braun Se7681 Silk-Epil 7681 Wet and Dry Epilator, White]]
  878. 1st time owner/user and am very happy with my purchase, took a little time to figure out how to use it but wouldn't hesistate to recommend.

  923. I am a first time epilator. Here are my experiences thus far.<br /><br />UNDERARMS: I bought this mostly for use on my underarms as I wanted a clean, no-darkness-from-hairs-under-the-skin look. I've had my underarms waxed a few times and this feels like getting a hundred first-time waxes over the span of 4 minutes. It is PAINFUL. The first time I did it I got many ingrown hairs but they came to the surface quickly. The second time I got only a couple of ingrown hairs but again, they came to the surface quickly. The third time no ingrown hairs. It hurts every time but with less growth/density it hurts less.<br /><br />FACE: I also bought this product to get rid of my sideburns/cheek hair that has plagued me for the majority of my hairy brown girl life. I never did anything to it until last year - I've had it threaded a few times which hurt like hell but made everything beautiful. Anyway, the first time I epilated my face it hurt, but no more than the threading, and the next day i had a small breakout of maybe 2-3 tiny bumps that turned to whiteheads very quickly and left very light marks that I knew would go away quickly, no big deal. The second time, just over 3 weeks ago, I cleaned the device and my face with rubbing alcohol to avoid breakouts. I guess the rubbing alcohol must have irritated and dried my skin out because immediately after finishing my face I had huge, warm, reddish bumps ALL OVER my cheeks. I thought they would go away overnight but they did not. A couple days later it began to look like the worst acne of my life. It was horrible, I didn't want to leave the house. I'm still dealing with some hyper pigmentation from the irritation but most of the bumps cleared without leaving marks. BE CAREFUL if you have sensitive skin. Do a test patch. Keep some aloe/vitamin E on hand. Even though it turned out horribly I will try again (very carefully) because the first time I was happy with the results.<br /><br />SHAVER: I used the shaver on my legs and it dida pretty great job. My leg hair was fully grown and pretty heavy and I had to go over some spots a few times, but I'm happy with the results.<br /><br />I have not used the epilator attachment on my arms or legs yet. I will be using it on my legs soon when the growth is about half a cm, but I am nervous because of the reaction I had on my underarms - I really do not want to be dealing with ingrown hairs/red bumps on my legs! My skin is translucent and I can see the hairs underneath the skin and the follicles are already pink or brown specks. I will update this review when I build up the courage to try this.

My Silk épil 7 came today, and had to try it as soon as I opened the box (I was very happy it came pre-charged so I could satisfy my need for instant gratification ;-) Initial impressions: the Silk épil 7 is outstanding! I've been performing some combination of shaving, epilating, and/or waxing over the past many years, and this gave me the best results I've gotten so far! I was a little reticent at first, because I had a Braun Epil a few years ago that was just ok, but I wanted to give the new one a try, and I'm so happy I did. This Silk épil 7 has so many great features, and it's performance exceeded my expectations. The additional accessories are a nice bonus, and the light is such a thoughtful addition (yikes! I hate to think about how much I've been missing with previous treatments...) I tried it on my legs and face, and used the massaging cover as well as the sensitive area cover, and got the same great results with different combinations of accessory. I highly recommend the Braun Silk épil 7 to anyone, and look forward to using it again! --------- 9/21/15 update: I've had the Silk épil 7 for over a month, and have used it 2-3 xs per week since receiving it through a BzzAgent campaign. My first impressions still hold, this is a great epilator, with the battery life of an energizer bunny! I had completely written off epilating several years ago after having frustrating experiences with other products (including Brauns' older models) and the Silk épil 7 has converted me back! Why you ask? There are 4 reasons: 1. The tweezing (or epilating) head is much more effective than any other I've tried. It grabs every hair without breaking it off, and does it quickly. I used mine for every area, and haven't had to go over the same area more than twice. 2. The head covers! They help to give so much more control and accuracy than anything I've ever used. The high-frequency massage cap has made a big difference in whether I end up with in-grown hairs (not a single one yet!) 3. The light... wow! I can only imagine what I'd been missing before! and finally, 4. The battery!! Like I mentioned, I've been using this 2-3x's/week for about 6 weeks and other than the initial charge, I have NOT re-charged it yet, and it's still going strong (if only my cell phone had a similar battery!!) I'm thrilled with the Silk épil 7 and cannot recommend it enough!
