  954. I have very thick, black hair that grows with insane abundance on my legs and I quite literally need to shave every single day without fail or by the next morning my legs have a 5 o'clock shadow (so to speak).<br /><br /> My aunt, cousin and sister in-law had all been chattering in my ears about these Epilators. Didn't sound so appealing to me honestly as I'm 5% curious and 95% chicken shit. Two of them had warned me how painful it was with the exception of my sister in-law who went above and beyond the call of duty with letting me know how painful epilating is when you first start. She shared with me her personal experience of having to have a few glasses of wine first which still didn't help much as she wound up in tears and she was only able to do a few minutes 1 day with the epilator, then more the next day, etc... Had me scratching my head wondering why the heck anyone would willingly self-torture with this machine if it was so darned bad.<br /><br /> I finally got tired of having to shave eeeevery single day and thought oh what the heck, why not? I felt the lump in my throat grow as I hit the \\"place order button\\" and I wasn't even sure if I was wasting my money I seriously doubted I had to guts to use the device I think I more loved the \\"idea\\" of it and hearing that after months you actually have hairs that just don't grow back anymore with the added bonus of not having to shave for weeks for the hairs that do grow back.<br /><br />As I waited until the epilator to arrive I was my own worst enemy anxiously worrying about how badly it would hurt, re-running the horror stories of others through my head. The day came it arrived and I read the booklet first that came with it. It suggested a hot shower or bath first to open the pores and make the experience less painful for first time epilators. I had my uber hot shower, used the free wipes that came with it in the box (to clean any soaps and/or creams off your skin), held my breath and more or less yelled Geronimo!!<br /><br />I used the device on the lowest setting (there are only two settings - first setting misses hairs but is gentler while the second setting is max speed and gets them all but hurts like hell to a newbie). I chose my knee for the test area to determine if it's a pain I can tolerate.<br /><br />The first few hairs hurt like hell but I'm sure it was only mostly to my brain hyping it all up for so long. After a few minutes I guess the skin goes a little numb and it hurts less. Some time later I decided I can't tolerate this epilating on a slow speed as it takes longer because you have to go over the same patches over and over so I jacked up the speed and did both of my legs. It hurt like hell let me tell you. Virgin hairs being pulled out on the \\"Efficiency\\" speed wasn't the smartest thing to do but it was better than dragging the experience out. The same thing that happened with my knee happened with my legs...after a while the legs go numb and the epilating is tolerable so I was thankful for that.<br /><br />It was hard to keep epilating, it did not feel great but at the same time it wasn't too too bad either. I had some minor issues later that day however. For a few hours after epilating for the first time my pores were stinging and at night I could not put a blanket on my legs as the skin was sore.<br /><br />If you epilate for the first time be advised your skin will turn beet red and it will sting for quite a while after. Also, some hairs tend to get pulled out with a small trace of blood behind them for the first time.<br /><br />I did a fair amount of research before buying this epialator and I am confident I made the right choice just based off the fact it hurt less than everyone had informed me it would.<br /><br />I love that this particular epilator came with a variety of different head covers as well as a trimming head. It came with a really nice little bag, cleaning brush and a package of special epliating wipes.<br /><br />Now that I've got some weeks under my belt with this thing here is the good and the bad of it all.<br /><br />The Good<br /><br />- Not too painful<br /><br />- Fast and efficient<br /><br />- 2 speeds<br /><br />- Built in light which really comes in handy for me<br /><br />- love the different types of heads it came with<br /><br />- Love that it seems to take less than 1 hour to charge<br /><br />- Looks pleasing<br /><br />- Came with a surprise freebie of a package of special wipes<br /><br />- It does make sound but it's not as loud as I would have expected<br /><br />- Easy to clean<br /><br />- Can be used wet or dry<br /><br />- Can be cleaned under a running tap<br /><br />The bad<br /><br />- Expensive<br /><br />Bottom line...<br /><br />It sucks I have to do this in the interest of saving time everyday in the shower but it's a necessary evil. After using it a few weeks I've come to highly value the service this tool provides as I only need to epilate once in a blue moon and have even started doing my arms with the device too. I am glad I started doing this even if it does hurt a bit. I can't say I recommend or don't recommend this product as epilating isn't for everyone. Depends on your pain threshold as well as your desire to try something like this but overall I myself and very happy with this product.
  955. Once you have you have used an epilator a couple of times the hair grows back slower & finer and it's not painful anymore.<br /><br />Pros:<br />-I prefer to use this dry, but I LOVE being able to wash it with water when I'm done<br />-The light helps you see what you've missed<br />-Two heads: epilator & clipper<br /><br />Cons:<br />-The clipper attachment is flimsy and breaks easily
  956. It's absolutely amazing, and will leave your skin feeling silky smooth! Initially, it was painful, but honestly it gets better with more uses. My underarm skin has lightened ever since I started using this, and the hair is no longer dark and course. I would definitely recommend this!

  959. pretty awesome, price though.<br /><br />a lot of my friends had these and i tried theirs out and liked it so much so I got my own. :)<br />I like how you can change the different heads on the epilator and that it comes with its cleaning brush and bag.
  960. So yes, I love it! used it for the first time right before going interior camping for 10 days and I had nice soft silky legs for most of the trip! incredible since I usually have to bring a razor and try to shave ever other day or so. It's windy and cold, I get goose bumps, cut myself...This was such a luxury! Now mind you the first use hurt SO bad, I would deliver a baby before agreeing to experience that again, but then my hair is dark, course and dense. The worst combination lol So five stars, cause really it's not the epilators I have so much hair. I now use it once to twice a week depending on my hair growth, and the pain is minimal. little pinchy sensation every now and then but for the most part the vibrating seems to mask the pain now. The razor head is OK, I have not worked up the courage to try the face, arm pits or bikini area (yet) but I plan to get there. But I love my legs! I plan to keep it up and NEVER let it all grow out again! I have experienced some ingrown hairs so exfoliation is key. Otherwise I am very happy and plan to bring it with me hunting fully charged and ready to go.
  961. The best epilator, I've ever had. It picks up the smallest hair ever.
  962. I really wanted this to work. I followed the instructions exactly and continued to use this product for about two months. I read countless blogs about epilating and tips for making it work better. I found that while it was very painful the first time, it became less painful each time. I used this almost every day for the entire two months. During that period, my legs were NEVER smooth. Some reviewers claimed that their legs were smoother than every, but that was not the case for me. I longed for the smoothness of freshly shaved legs. I finally gave up and went back to shaving. I never minded shaving and I'm not prone to cuts and nicks, I was interested in the epilator because I thought it would be a weekly hair removal solution as opposed to having to shave three or four times per week. Instead I was epliating every day and still not achieving smooth legs. Shaving is a lot less painful and yet provides smoother results. I really don't think this epilator is the problem, epliating just won't work for me.<br />Pros: the shaver works well.

When I did though, the 'pain' was what I thought it would be, kind of a quick sting, then it goes away immediately. Overall I like it, I am hoping I will use it more and more.

  973. This product rips the hairs out by the roots, much like a tweezers, but many hairs at once. It is very effective and after using it for a while, the hairs will start to grow in thinner and weaker. But if you have a low pain tolerance, or have a medical condition that makes you sensitive (Fibromyalgia, Nueropathy etc) then I would not recommend this product.

  976. Although painful, an epilator saved me the time and money I would have to invest on waxing. I had previously used another product for just my legs. Reading the other amazon reviews for Braun, I decided to go with the more expensive version of Braun. And I am happy! The first few minutes are painful, and then I got used to it. It works in the shower, which is even better because I don't have anymore the problem with ingrown hair as with the previous product (but I also followed the advice of others to exfoliate every few days). The battery life has been great so far. It is also easy to clean and put away.
  977. Works great. Takes a couple of tries on thicket stubborn hair, but leaves silky smooth skin for days!!!
  978. Been using it about 2 months now. I'm female in my 30's and have some hormone related facial stubbles (upper lip, under chin/neck). I've done laser and electrolysis but what seems to be never ending and expensive I figured I'd give this a shot. And actually works really well so far! The thing is you have to wait for the different hair cycles to go through and you'll see less and less hair. Of course this isn't permanent but I use this once a week now and my face is super smooth once again! I have not noticed any ingrowns except for one hair, but with my fair sensitive skin I get that even without epilating.<br /><br />Pain is very tolerable, no worse than laser and definitely not as bad as electrolysis. I use the fastest setting and with the leg adapter because it gets a slightly wider area than the facial one (but I started going by the directions first). I also exfoliate once or twice a week also.<br /><br />One of the great things is it only seems to get rid of the more coarse hair and leaves the fine wispy hairs untouched which makes things feel more natural.<br /><br />Not sure what the long term effects of use but so far I have no complaints in the 2 months. Glad I took a chance after reading so many warnings and negative articles about epilators.<br /><br />Also tested on my legs a smaller area. Surprisingly I got much redder, which went away after 2 days. Didn't do the whole thing but results were good and no ingrowns. Pain was a little more intense because of a bigger area. But again, pain is nothing compared to laser or electro.

  990. I started using this product on my legs about six months ago. Each use hurt and after a while I stopped using it because I wasn't sure if the pain was worth the effort. After two or three months, however, I noticed that I only had to shave my legs once a week because my hair regrowth was really slow and a lot sparser than normal. I used to have to shave everyday for smooth legs because I have such thick, coarse hair, so this was great. I think the pattern of regrowth is due to having used the Braun for a few months, so I decided to get it back out and continue using it every once in a while because the much slower and lighter regrowth of hair is definitely worth it for me.<br /><br />I would recommend this product. I'm giving it 4 instead of 5 stars because it hurts to use, but it does get better as you get used to the process.
  991. It is my second epilator from Braun and I think it is so much better than any other method you might think off. My first one does not work here in the States because of Voltage.
  992. It works really well. Removes hair without discomfort and lasts for about 3 days which is good. Good price also.
  993. My friend let me try her Braun, and I fell in love with it. I can forget about shaving my legs now! What a relief! In the summer time, it's like a blessing. It is a little painful when you first use the epilator, but it's tolerable and will not be painful when you use it again for maintenance. I would advise against using it on your underarms and please be very careful with the bikini zone! It takes some patience and a well-lit bathroom, but it's worth it. I do not get any ingrown hairs any more either. What an excellent invention!
  994. I am disappointed with this product as my legs will never be smooth, hair free as I was hoping, there is always stubble due to the different rate of new hair growth and the fact that the tweezers DO NOT remove new short hair growth. Description indicates it will pick up tiny hairs as small as a grain of sand, this sadly is not fact. Yes, it is true the hair that grows in is much thinner, therefore the stubble is not awful as in the past. I hope with newer technology, Braun will eventually come out with a model that will actually mreove new short hair growth. I will continue to use the product, however in the summer I will still have to shave my legs to get a close shave and have smooth legs hair free. As far as the pain, it was uncomfortable the first time on my legs, but after that, you do get used to it. It just tingles on my arms, then itches a bit . I am however too scared at this time to use it on the bikini line but I will get there at some point.
